title: Bowl Meals
tips:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

 

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Cranberry and Orange Granola, Meal Prep Sushi Bowls, and Crispy Falafel And Chopped Salad Bowls , here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat the oven to 350 F / 175 C.
  2. Get the chickpeas for the falafel into the oven. 
  3. Make the sauce and prepare the rice for the sushi bowls.
  4. Make the falafel batter. 
  5. Get your protein cooking and make the sriracha mayo for the sushi bowls.
  6. Lower the oven temp to 300 F / 150 C and bake your granola, making sure to check it often so it does not burn.  
  7. Make the dressing for the falafel salads, then fry the falafel.
  8. While the granola cools, assemble sushi bowls and store your falafel bowl ingredients buffet style. 
  9. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

 

Sweet Potato Breakfast Hash Bowls and  Zucchini Carrot Rice Noodle Bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. This prep is best prepared one recipe at a time. Begin with the sweet potato breakfast hash bowls and while it cools make the zucchini carrot rice noodle bowls.
  3. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: February 1st, 2023 Meal Plan
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Morning Glory Muffins, Mango Curry, and Black Bean Soup here's how to get it done fast:

 Get your kitchen clean and ready!  Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.  Preheat your oven to 350 F (175 C). 

Make your rice for the curry. While that cooks, mix your batter for the muffins. 

Get your muffins in the oven. Get the protein for your curry cooking while they bake. 

Start the soup while you finish cooking the curry. 

Let the muffins cool on a wire rack once they are done. Assemble the curry into containers to cool while you finish up the soup. 

Once the soup is done, assemble that into containers and let it cool. 

Put away your cooled food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Savory Cheddar Jalapeno Waffles and Salmon/Chickpea Orzo for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! 

Make your salmon or chickpeas for the orzo, then start the orzo. 

Cook the bacon for the cheddar jalapeno waffles. 

Heat up the waffle iron then prep your waffle batter.. 

Make your waffles and let them cool on a wire rack. 

Finish up your salmon/chickpea orzo salad and assemble it into containers. 

Put away your cooled food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Takeout-Inspired Meal Plan
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Raspberry Swirl Doughnuts, Famous Bowls, and Poke Bowls here's how to get it done fast:

Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.

There are a lot of moving pieces/components in this prep, so we recommend focusing on one recipe at a time!

Preheat the oven to 375F / 190C.

Prepare the doughnut batter and get them into the preheated oven. Make the icing while they bake. 

Make the components for the famous bowls on the stovetop. 

While the famous bowl ingredients are cooling, start on the poke bowls. 

Assemble the poke bowls after the ingredients have cooled (see notes about storing some of the ingredients separately). 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Starbucks Wraps and Cheeseburger Calzones for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!

Preheat the oven to 400 F / 200 C. 

Get started on the dough for the calzones. 

While the dough rests/rises, begin prepping the eggs for the Starbucks wraps.

While the eggs bake in the oven, prepare the filling for the calzone Starbucks wraps on the stovetop. 

Assemble the calzones and place them in the oven. 

While the calzones bake, assemble the Starbucks wraps (not if you’re using GF wraps! GF tortillas hold together best if wrapped right before eating). 

You’re done! Let everything cool before storing in the fridge!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Zucchini Carrot Bread, Banh Mi Bowls, and Sweet Potato Wraps here's how to get it done fast:

Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 375 F / 190 C. 

Make your zucchini bread batter and get it in the oven. 

While your bread bakes, prep your quick pickled veggies and make your rice for the Banh Mi bowls. 

Cook your protein for the bowls and take your bread out of the oven when it’s done. Increase the oven temp to 425 F / 220 C. 

Get your sweet potatoes in the oven and then add the chickpeas. 

Assemble your bowls while your sweet potatoes and chickpeas cool. Once they’re cooled completely you can assemble the wraps. 

Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the One-Bowl Blueberry Crisp For Breakfast (Or Dessert!), Broccoli Cheddar Chicken/Tofu Loaded Baked Potatoes and Butternut Squash Soup With Roasted Chickpeas, here's how to get it done fast:
 

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep/chop your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat the oven to 400 F / 200 C. Roast the potatoes for 60 minutes, adding the chicken at 30 minute mark and the broccoli at the 20 minute mark.
  3. While everything roasts, prepare the Blueberry Crisp and set aside.
  4. Prepare the soup on the stovetop. Set aside to cool.
  5. Prepare the sauce for the Broccoli Cheddar Potatoes.
  6. When the potatoes, chicken & broccoli are done baking, roast the chickpeas for the Butternut soup for 15 minutes. Set aside.
  7. Lower the oven to 350 F / 175 C and put the blueberry crisp into the oven to bake.
  8. Allow everything to cool before storing it in the fridge.

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Easy Easy Zucchini Fritters  and Creamy Garlic Pasta with Roasted Veggies for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Preheat the oven to 400 F / 200 C and roast the veggies for the Creamy Garlic Pasta.
  3. While the veggies roast, start the pasta water and make the sauce for the Creamy Garlic Pasta.
  4. Prepare the zucchini fritters and then cook them on the stovetop.
  5. Assemble the Creamy Garlic Pasta and Roasted Veggies
  6. You’re done! Let everything cool to room temperature before storing in the fridge!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Banana Blondies, Thai Coconut Noodle Soup and the Pesto Dump & Bake Pasta, here's how to get it done fast:
 

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep/chop your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C.
  3. Put together the Pesto Dump & Bake Pasta and put it in the oven.
  4. Make the Thai Coconut Soup on the stovetop.
  5. While the soup is cooling, prepare the batter for the Banana Blondies.
  6. Remove the pasta from the oven and turn the heat down to 350 F / 175 C.
  7. Bake the blondies in the oven.
  8. Allow everything to cool completely before storing it in the fridge.

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Easy Sausage & Kale Breakfast Burritos and One-Pan Southwestern Rice Skillet for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Cook the ingredients for the Sausage & Kale Breakfast Burritos.
  3. While the burrito ingredients are cooling, make the One-Pan Southwestern Rice Skillet on the stovetop.
  4. As the skillet simmers, assemble the burritos (not if using GF burrito wrappers - it’s best to wrap those immediately before eating). Seal on the stovetop, if desired.
  5. You’re done! Let everything cool to room temperature before storing in the fridge!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: June No-Reheat Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the No Bake Tahini Date Bars: Dates play a pretty big part in these bars so we would not skip them. We use almonds, but sub any nut you like best! You can use your favorite nut butter in place of tahini, or use sunflower seed butter for a nut-free option. You can swap honey or agave for maple syrup, but we do not recommend using granulated sugar because you need the moisture that the liquid sweeteners provide!

For the Honey Mustard Chicken/Tempeh Salad: There are so many ways to customize this salad. You can swap out the veggies, add more carbs or change up the protein. Read the full recipe notes for a list of ingredients that will work best for you. 

For the Springy Pasta Salad: Any type of short pasta will work! You can also change up the veggies by adding broccoli, bell pepper, thinly sliced carrots, mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, radishes, yellow bell pepper, spinach, arugula, cucumber or red onion. Chickpeas, pinto beans, white beans, shredded chicken or cooked chicken sausage would all be complementary protein choices.

For the Green Smoothie: We used frozen mango as the star ingredient of this green smoothie, but you can substitute any tropical fruits you want! For the brightest green color, stick to yellow or green fruits like kiwi, pineapple, peaches or mandarin oranges.  

For the Sonoma White Bean Wraps: Substitute chicken or canned tuna for the white beans! Any chopped nut or seed you have on hand would work well in this wrap. Swap up the fruits and vegetables apples, pears, grapes, carrots or peppers. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure your oats are GF for the no bake bars. The omni version of the honey mustard salad is gluten free as written, but if you’re making the veg/vegan version, you’ll need GF flour for the cauliflower batter! Use your favorite GF pasta for the springy pasta salad. Don’t forget to pick up your favorite GF burrito-size tortillas for the white bean wraps. 

Dairy-free swaps: You’ll want to use vegan chocolate chips for the bars. If you’re making the vegetarian/vegan version of the honey mustard salad, you will need non-dairy milk for the cauliflower batter. Sub tahini for yogurt in the springy pasta salad. Or you could buy some non-dairy yogurt as a like-for-like swap, since you’ll need non-dairy yogurt for the smoothies. The white bean wraps are GF as written!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out to us: support@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the No Bake Tahini Date Bars, Honey Mustard Chicken/Tempeh Salad and the Springy Pasta Salad, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep/chop your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. 
  2. Preheat your oven to 375 F / 190 C and boil a large pot of water for the pasta.
  3. Bake the bacon/tempeh bacon in the oven.
  4. Boil the pasta for the springy pasta salad according to the directions on the package - note that we cook the veggies IN the pasta water, as well!
  5. While the bacon cooks and the pasta boils, prepare the dressings for the pasta salad and the honey mustard salad. 
  6. Cook the chicken/cauliflower for the honey mustard salad.
  7. Make the no-bake bars and refrigerate immediately. 
  8. Assemble the springy pasta salad and the honey mustard chicken salad.
  9. Allow everything to cool before storing it in the fridge. 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Green Smoothie and Sonoma White Bean Wraps for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare the ingredients for each recipe. No need to preheat the oven or even turn on the cooktop for this super simple mid-week prep!
  2. Make the smoothies and put them in the freezer. 
  3. Prepare the white bean salad and wrap ‘em up! Note that if you’re making gluten free wraps, we find that it’s best to store the white bean salad separately and wrap it just before eating.
  4. You’re done! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: June Member's Favorites Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Berry Parfaits with Granola: This granola is great without add-ins, but feel free to add chopped pecans, almonds or walnuts. Dried fruit- dried cranberries or golden raisins would also be good! 

For the Coconut Quinoa Thai Tofu/Shrimp Salad: Replace quinoa with any grain of your choice. You can swap romaine or kale for the broccoli slaw. Adding fresh chopped avocado will also make this even more filling. There are lots of veggie swap options - read the full recipe notes here.

For the Steak/Tempeh & Spinach Bagel Panini: You can use any sturdy/thick cut sandwich bread, ciabatta, or even flatbreads. Sirloin, top round, and ribeye are great cuts of meat for this sandwich. Look for something well-marbled, which indicates the meat will be tender. You could also use a shortcut sauce, like a store-bought aioli, dressing, or pesto.

For the Easy Zucchini Bread for Breakfast or Snacks: Chopped walnuts, almonds, cashews or dried cranberries would be great add-ins. Turn this into zucchini carrot bread by replacing 1/2 the shredded zucchini with 1/2 a cup of shredded carrots.

For the Loaded Freezer Burritos: There are so many options for veggie swaps! The only veggie that wouldn't work (that I can think of) are cucumbers. Chicken sausage, ground beef, steak, and chorizo would all be fantastic protein swaps! If you don't want to use black beans, try pinto!

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure your oats are GF for the granola! Swap the soy sauce with tamari for a gluten-free coconut quinoa Thai salad. Select your favorite GF bagels or sturdy bread for the paninis. Don’t forget your favorite GF tortillas for the burritos!

Dairy-free swaps: Pick up some vegan butter & dairy-free yogurt for the granola. You’ll use the vegan butter again for the zucchini bread, which will also require vegan chocolate chips! Non-dairy cream cheese is needed for the paninis. Have some dairy-free shredded cheese on hand for the burritos. The coconut quinoa is dairy-free as written! 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out to us: support@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Berry Parfaits with Granola, Coconut Quinoa Thai Tofu/Shrimp Salad and the Steak/Tempeh & Spinach Bagel Panini, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep/chop your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. 
  2. Preheat your oven to 325 F / 165 C.
  3. While the oven preheats, prepare the granola ingredients and bake it when the oven is ready. 
  4. While the granola bakes, prepare the quinoa on the stovetop. 
  5. Make the balance of the quinoa Thai salad on the stovetop. Set aside to cool.
  6. Cook the components for the paninis.
  7. Prepare the dressing for the quinoa salad and the dijon cream cheese for the paninis. 
  8. Assemble the quinoa salads and the parfaits.
  9. Allow everything to cool before storing it in the fridge. Note that you may want to store the ingredients for the parfaits and the paninis separately so that they don’t get soggy.

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

  4. While the zucchini bread bakes, prepare the rice and veggies for the loaded burritos. The chicken will go into the oven when the zucchini bread is finished baking. Be sure to turn your oven up to 375 F / 190 C for the chicken.

title: May 30-Minute Meals Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Coconut Caramel Chocolate Chip Waffles: Use buttermilk instead of regular milk for a more traditional texture! Want to turn these into pancakes? Keep the recipe the same, just use a skillet instead of a waffle iron.
 

For the Cilantro and Citrus Couscous Salad: There are so many ways to customize this salad! We recommend reading the full recipe notes to gather ideas for veggie, grain and protein swaps! 

For the Shrimp/Cauliflower Tacos: If you choose shrimp that needs to be deveined and de-shelled, your prep will take a bit longer - just a heads up! Store bought taco seasoning will work great, but if you want to make your own blend you can find our go-to recipe here. 

For the Cinnamon Oatmeal Cookie ONO’s: You have to use rolled oats/old fashioned oats or quick oats in ONO’s - don't use steel cut! You can use any milk you like - water will work, as well. Don't like raisins? No problem, you can use craisins, golden raisins, other dried fruit and/or chocolate chips instead! 

For the Antipasto Orzo: We lean on canned ingredients for this hearty salad, but you can always use fresh! This meal is so versatile - you can swap out nearly ALL of the ingredients! Read the full recipe notes for inspiration.  

Gluten-free swaps: Swap your favorite tried-and-true GF flours for the waffles! Pick up some gluten free couscous for the cilantro citrus salad - you could swap quinoa for couscous, as well. You’ll also need gluten free tortillas for the shrimp/cauliflower tacos! Make sure that you use GF oats for the ONO’s! Don’t forget your favorite GF orzo for antipasto salad - really, any shape of GF pasta will work!

Dairy-free swaps: You’ll need non-dairy milk and vegan butter for the waffle recipe. Swap non-dairy milk in the ONO’s. Sub out your favorite non-dairy hard cheese for mozzarella in the antipasto salad. The cilantro citrus couscous salad and the tacos are dairy-free as written!
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Coconut Caramel Chocolate Chip Waffles, Cilantro and Citrus Couscous Salad and the Shrimp/Cauliflower Tacos, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep/chop your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. 
  2. Preheat the waffle iron to medium/high and the oven to 350F / 175C to toast the coconut for the waffles. 
  3. Boil ¾ cup of water on the stovetop or in the microwave for the couscous. 
  4. While the coconut toasts, make the batter for the waffles. 
  5. Once the coconut is done toasting, remove from the oven and allow it to cool. 
  6. Turn the oven up to 400F / 200C to roast the corn for the tacos.
  7. Cook the waffles and cool on a wire rack. 
  8. Make the dressings for couscous salad and the tacos and cook the shrimp/cauliflower for the tacos. 
  9. Assemble the couscous salad, and tacos. 
  10. Allow everything to cool before storing it in the fridge and don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Cinnamon Oatmeal Cookie ONO’s and Antipasto Orzo for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! 
  2. Boil a large pot of water on the stovetop to cook the orzo. 
  3. While waiting for the water to boil, assemble the ONO’s and put them in the fridge to “cook”. 
  4. Cook the pasta in the boiling water according to directions. 
  5. While the pasta cooks, make the dressing and assemble the orzo salad ingredients. 
  6. You’re done! Let everything cool before storing in the fridge!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: May Takeout Inspired Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Raspberry Swirl Doughnuts: Don't have a doughnut pan? No worries - you can make muffins, instead. Sub coconut oil or butter for vegetable oil. Not into raspberries? Use strawberries in their place! 

For the Famous Bowls: There are lots of time-saving swap options for this bowl: use frozen chicken tenders or nuggets, pre-packaged or instant potatoes, jarred gravy and frozen veggies for a quick prep! 

For the Poke Bowls: Poke bowls are extremely customizable. Swap the veggies, carb, protein or sauce. We recommend reading the full recipe notes for inspiration!

For the Starbucks Wraps: Since this is a copycat recipe, playing with it too much will make it taste different from the real deal at Starbucks. But it's your kitchen, your rules, so we made a list of swap options here. Consider making a double batch for your freezer stash!

For the Cheeseburger Calzones: You can easily swap in your favorite store bought pizza dough to make these calzones in half the time. Swap the spinach & tomato with your favorite cooked greens, bell peppers, or mushrooms. If you love pickles on burgers, you can add them, as well. Think of whatever toppings you love on a cheeseburger and feel free to add them! Have fun with it.

Gluten-free swaps: You’ll need your favorite GF flour for the doughnuts, famous bowls and calzones! Have some GF breadcrumbs on hand if you’re making homemade tenders for the famous bowls. Swap liquid aminos or tamari for the soy sauce in both the famous bowl and the poke bowl. Use GF tortillas for the Starbucks wraps, and note that they will hold together best if wrapped right before eating.

Dairy-free swaps: Swap out your favorite dairy-free milk, butter & shredded cheese for the famous bowls. Dairy-free cheese slices will taste great on the calzones! A non-dairy hard cheese (like parmesan) or chopped olives will work in place of feta for the Starbucks wraps. If you’re vegan, you’ll need vegan mayo for the poke bowls and the calzones.

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out to us: 

support@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Raspberry Swirl Doughnuts, Famous Bowls, and Poke Bowls here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. There are a lot of moving pieces/components in this prep, so we recommend focusing on one recipe at a time!
  3. Preheat the oven to 375F / 190C.
  4. Prepare the doughnut batter and get them into the preheated oven. Make the icing while they bake. 
  5. Make the components for the famous bowls on the stovetop. 
  6. While the famous bowl ingredients are cooling, start on the poke bowls. 
  7. Assemble the poke bowls after the ingredients have cooled (see notes about storing some of the ingredients separately). 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Starbucks Wraps and Cheeseburger Calzones for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Preheat the oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  3. Get started on the dough for the calzones. 
  4. While the dough rests/rises, begin prepping the eggs for the Starbucks wraps.
  5. While the eggs bake in the oven, prepare the filling for the calzone Starbucks wraps on the stovetop. 
  6. Assemble the calzones and place them in the oven. 
  7. While the calzones bake, assemble the Starbucks wraps (not if you’re using GF wraps! GF tortillas hold together best if wrapped right before eating). 
  8. You’re done! Let everything cool before storing in the fridge!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: May Minimal Cooking Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Chocolate Peanut Butter ONOs: Substitute the cocoa powder with your favorite chocolate-flavored protein powder. Substitute up to 1/4 cup of yogurt for the milk. Old fashioned oats work best. Instant can work, but the texture will be a little different. Don't use steel-cut oats!

For the Variety Lover's Snack Box: It’s super easy to customize these snack boxes and the options are endless! Read the recipe notes for more inspiration. 

For the Peanut Curry Cold Noodles: Swap ramen for spaghetti, rice, soba or buckwheat noodles. Chicken, shrimp, pork or tofu would be awesome protein swaps! 

For the Matcha Pancakes: These pancakes are pretty straight forward, but we think blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, sliced banana, coconut flakes, chocolate chips, white chocolate chips or chopped walnuts would be great additions!

For the Black Bean Soup: You can use red onion, mushrooms, any color bell pepper, zucchini, celery, radishes, cauliflower, greens, or any other veggies you have lying around! Switch up the protein: Black beans are the source of protein here, but if you want to make it even more filling, shredded chicken would be our first choice. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure that you have GF oats for the overnight oats! You’ll need GF tortillas and pita bread for the snack boxes. Rice ramen is a great swap for the peanut curry noodles - you’ll also need to swap tamari for soy sauce. Use your favorite all purpose GF flour for the pancakes. The black bean soup is gluten free AS IS!

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the overnight oats. Pick up some hard non-dairy cheese for the snack box. Non-dairy yogurt is needed for the matcha pancakes. The peanut noodles and black bean soup are dairy-free as written!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out to us: 

support@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Chocolate Peanut Butter ONOs, Variety Lover's Snack Box, and Peanut Curry Cold Noodles here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Cook the edamame according to the package and set aside.
  3. Bring a pot of water to boil for the ramen.
  4. While you wait for the water to come to a boil, prepare the sauce for the cold noodles. 
  5. Boil the ramen and then assemble the cold noodle salads. 
  6. While the noodles cool, assemble the snack boxes and the ONO’s. 
  7. That’s IT! Get ready for a delicious first half of your week! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Matcha Pancakes and Black Bean Soup for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Chop the veggies and measure out the pancake ingredients.
  2. Prepare the pancake batter and cook them on the stovetop. 
  3. While the pancakes are cooling on a wire rack, make the black bean soup on the stovetop.
  4. You’re done! Let everything cool before storing in the fridge!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: May Member's Favorites
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Lemon Blueberry Scones: If you're using frozen blueberries, lightly coat them in flour. This will help prevent the batter from turning purple!

For the BLATs: We like Roma tomatoes because they are easy to find, but beefsteak or other large heirloom varieties would work. We used romaine lettuce, but if you prefer iceberg lettuce, butter lettuce, spinach, or sprouts, use those instead. If you don't love avocado, try swapping for hummus or sliced cheese to maintain the moisture barrier. Or, just add mayo to the second slice of bread! 

For the Brussels Sprout Pasta: If you don’t like sausage, chopped or shredded chicken would be great. Shrimp or white beans could also work! Any pasta shape will work so choose your favorite. We wouldn't recommend omitting the brussels sprouts because they are the star of the show here! However, feel free to add more veggies such as zucchini, broccoli, asparagus, green beans, onion, or shallot.

For the Chorizo Breakfast Burritos: Almost any veggies you have lying around in your fridge can work! The Chorizo/Soyrizo gives these breakfast burritos a ton of great flavor, but if this protein isn't your favorite, you can replace it with sausage, bacon, veggie "meat crumbles", or black/pinto beans.

For the Mediterranean Farro Bowls: It’s super easy to customize these bowls and the options are endless! Read the recipe notes for specific protein and veggie swaps. You can even swap out the grain if you don’t care for farro!

Gluten-free swaps: For the lemon blueberry scones, use a GF flour blend you trust. All-purpose GF flour works well for me! If your GF flour doesn't have xantham gum, you'll need to add 1/2 a teaspoon for 2 cups of flour. Swap GF bread for the BLATs. When preparing the brussels sprouts pasta use your favorite GF pasta. Use GF tortillas for the burritos, and note that they will hold together best if wrapped right before eating. Finally, swap the farro with quinoa in the mediterranean bowls. 

Dairy-free swaps: To make the lemon blueberry scones dairy-free, use oil and non-dairy milk to sub for heavy cream (2/3 cup rice or soy milk combined with 1/3 cup olive oil or melted dairy-free margarine). The brussels sprouts pasta will need vegan butter in place of dairy butter and nutritional yeast in place of parmesan cheese. Use your favorite dairy free cheese in the breakfast burritos and mediterranean bowls. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out to us: 

support@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Lemon Blueberry Scones, BLATs, and Brussels Sprout Pasta here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat the oven to 400 F (200 C). 
  3. Prep the brussels sprouts and get them in the oven.  
  4. While the brussels roast, prepare and chill the dough for the scones. 
  5. Boil some water in a large pot on the stovetop for the pasta.
  6. When the brussels are done, set them aside and get the scones in the oven. 
  7. While the scones bake, cook the pasta and prepare the rest of the brussels sprouts pasta on the stove top. This is a good time to assemble the aioli, bread and veggies for the BLATs, as well. 
  8. When the scones are out of the oven, you can bake the bacon/tempeh bacon for the BLATs. 
  9. Finish assembling the BLATs and brussels sprout pasta, let them cool in meal prep containers and then pop them in the fridge. The scones can be stored in an airtight container on the counter for 3-4 days. Get ready for an amazing first half of your week!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Chorizo Breakfast Burritos and Mediterranean Farro Bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Chop the veggies and get everything in place. 
  2. Preheat the oven to 375 F (190 C).
  3. Boil a large pot of water for the farro. 
  4. Bake the chicken and zucchini for the bowls. 
  5. While the chicken and zucchini are in the oven, boil the farro according to the directions on the package. 
  6. Next, prepare the breakfast burrito filling on the stovetop. 
  7. While the burrito filling cools, prepare the balance of the mediterranean bowl ingredients and the tahini sauce (if using). 
  8. Assemble the bowls, wrap the burritos (not if you're using GF tortillas!) and let everything cool before storing in the fridge!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: Customizable Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Breakfast Fried Rice: Use leftover rice instead of fresh! You can also make this with quinoa. Use sliced or crumbled breakfast sausage or cubed ham instead of (or in addition to) bacon. Omit the meat altogether. Swap out the veggies: carrots, peas, broccoli, cubed potatoes, edamame, onions, shredded cabbage, and zucchini would all be tasty in this recipe.

For the Roasted Cauliflower, Zucchini and Red Bell Pepper Mac N’ Cheese: Swap out any veggie that will roast well (which includes most of them). Pro tip: if you're in a rush, go for zucchini, summer squash, tomatoes, asparagus, broccoli, mushrooms and onions -- vegetables that roast quickly. Any "short" pasta will work: Penne, macaroni elbows, rotini, ziti, bowtie pasta etc. You could even swap for a protein pasta, like Banza! Speaking of protein, why not add another source like sliced sausage, browned ground meat or shredded chicken? Chickpeas or white beans would be excellent vegetarian/vegan options. Finally, you can change up the cheese. For classic mac n’ cheese you can't go wrong with cheddar, but mozzarella, pepper jack, Monterey jack or even a mixture of these would work great! 

For the Everyday Kale Salad: Feel free to add protein to this salad! Simple grilled chicken or chickpeas would be my first choice, but really anything could work. If you just don't like feta, swap it out for gorgonzola, blue cheese, or goat cheese! Don’t care for almonds? You can swap for walnuts, cashews, peanuts, seeds, or croutons. Use cranberries or regular raisins in place of golden raisins - or skip them all together. Adding avocado would be a delicious finish!

For the Bagel Boats: Mix up the veggies! Kale, onions, bell pepper, broccoli, and tomatoes would all be great swaps for this savory breakfast creation. Feel free to switch up the protein or add a little bit more. Cooked bacon, sausage, tempeh, or your favorite vegan meat alternative would add more bulk to these boats. 

For the 30-Minute Soba Noodle Stir Fry: Stir Fry customizations are super easy and the options are endless! Read the recipe notes for specific protein and veggie swaps. You can also switch up the noodles!

Gluten-free swaps: Use tamari or liquid aminos instead of soy sauce for the breakfast fried rice and the soba noodle salad. Select your favorite GF pasta & breadcrumbs for the mac n’ cheese, as well as GF flour! Swap out gluten-free bagels for the bagel boats.

Dairy-free swaps: For the roasted veggie mac n’ cheese, you’ll need dairy free butter, nutritional yeast in place of parmesan and shredded non-dairy cheese (any kind!). You’ll use the shredded non-dairy cheese again later in the week for the bagel boats. Pick up some non-dairy crumbled cheese (like vegan feta) for the kale salads.

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out to us: 

support@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Breakfast Fried Rice, Roasted Veggie Mac, and Kale Salads here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat the oven to 400 F / 200 C.
  3. Chop and roast the veggies in the oven for the mac n’ cheese.
  4. On the stovetop, start the rice for the breakfast fried rice and boil some water in a dutch oven for the mac n’ cheese pasta. 
  5. In a saute pan on the stovetop, begin cooking the breakfast fried rice.
  6. Add the pasta to the boiling water and cook according to instructions. Drain the pasta in a colander and rinse with cold water to cease cooking. 
  7. In the same pan that you made the pasta in, make the sauce for the mac n’ cheese. 
  8. Assemble both stovetop meals. 
  9. While the stovetop meals cool, begin chopping the veggies and making the dressing for the kale salad. 
  10. Assemble your salads, put away your food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Bagel Boats and 30-Minute Soba Noodle Stir Fry for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Preheat the oven to 400 F / 200 C
  2. Prepare the soba noodles as directed on the packaging and then set aside for assembly.
  3. Prep the bagel boats and get them in the oven.
  4. Chop the veggies for the stir fry and set out the ingredients for the stir fry sauce. We find it easiest to stir fry when we have all of our ingredients close at hand! 
  5. Prepare the stir fry and set aside to cool.
  6. Remove bagel boats from the oven and place them on a cooling rack.
  7. Assemble your prepped meals, put away your food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: April Low Waste Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Peaches & Cream Baked Oatmeal:  We're using frozen peaches, but you can absolutely use fresh or a drained can of peaches.

For the Coconut Lentil Soup: If you want to add meat to this, shredded or diced chicken would be good options. If you don’t care for lentils, you could swap chickpeas, black beans or tofu. Carrot or russet potato would be great swaps for the sweet potato.  Spinach, chard or zucchini would be great swaps for the kale. Make sure to add greens later in the cooking process to avoid overcooking. 

For the Balsamic Mushroom White Bean Pasta: This pasta dish is so versatile! Follow the recipe notes for specific customizations but feel free to search your pantry and fridge to make this as low waste as possible! 

For the Everything Bagel Waffles: You could use whole-wheat instead of all-purpose. You can also use half white, half whole wheat. If you don’t have nutritional yeast, parmesan would be a great swap. Add in some chopped bacon or “facon”. If you like it spicy, add some sriracha, cayenne or chili powder. Buttermilk in place of regular milk will give the waffles a more traditional texture!

For the Hot Honey Mustard Sheet Pan: Sheet pan customizations are super easy and the options are endless! Read the recipe notes for specific protein swaps. You could also switch up the veggies: instead of pearl onions, try leeks or the onion of your choice. Broccoli, cauliflower, Brussels sprouts, cabbage, and beets would all be delicious!

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free oats for the peaches and cream baked oatmeal, your favorite gluten-free flour & pasta for the balsamic mushroom white bean pasta and gluten-free bagels for the bagel boats.

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk, butter and yogurt for the peaches & cream oatmeal bake. Use non-dairy butter or olive oil, dairy-free milk  and nutritional yeast in place of the parmesan for the balsamic mushroom white bean pasta. If you use non-dairy milk such as almond milk in the pasta, we suggest adding a teaspoon or two of onion powder to offset any sweet taste from the milk. The everything bagel waffles will need non-dairy milk and cream cheese. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out to us at: 

support@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Peaches and Cream Baked Oatmeal, Lentil Soup, and White Bean Pasta here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat the oven to 375 F / 190 C. 
  3. Start by making the oatmeal and getting it in the oven. Take advantage of passive time!
  4. Get started on the balsamic white bean pasta. Fill a dutch oven with water, bring to a boil and cook according to the label. Before you drain the pasta, reserve 1-2 cups of the pasta water. Keep the pasta in the colander and cover it with a clean kitchen towel. Set the pasta water aside. 
  5. Make the lentil soup in the now empty dutch oven. We love one pot meals!
  6. Remove the oatmeal from the oven and allow it to cool before slicing and assembling. 
  7. While the soup cooks and the oatmeal cools, finish preparing the balsamic white bean pasta by preparing the mushrooms and the roux in a large skillet or deep saute pan. 
  8. Let the soup and pasta cool before assembling. 
  9. Assemble your prepped meals, put away your food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Everything Bagel Waffles and Hot Honey Sheet Pan Sausage for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Preheat the oven to 400 F / 200 C and preheat the waffle iron. 
  3. Assemble the sheet pan meal ingredients and get it in the oven. 
  4. While the sheet pan meal cooks, make the waffle batter and start batch cooking the waffles in your iron. 
  5. Remove the sheet pan from the oven and allow the contents to cool.
  6. Finish up the last batch of waffles and allow them to cool completely on a wire rack. 
  7. Assemble your prepped meals, put away your food, clean up, then relax!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: April Budget-Friendly Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Mango Nut Butter Smoothies: Frozen mango, peaches or papaya will work and might be more affordable than fresh mangos! Use your favorite nut butter or sunflower seed butter if you have allergies. 

For the Horchata Overnight Oats: If you don’t have allspice, you can use pumpkin pie spice instead. Use agave or maple syrup instead of honey if you don’t have it. 

For the Egg Salad: Follow the recipe notes for specific customizations but feel free to search your pantry and fridge to make this as low cost as possible! 

For the Sausage & Veggie Stovetop Meal: Change up the potatoes to your liking, along with the veggies based on what’s in season or on sale near you. Use your favorite pre-cooked sausage to keep this an easy, one pot meal. 

For the Lentil Taco Skillet: Switch up the red bell pepper for another color bell pepper, and use whatever beans you have on hand in your pantry instead of black beans. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free oats for the horchata overnight oats and your favorite gluten-free bread or crackers for the egg salad. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk and yogurt for the smoothies and overnight oats, and use non-dairy butter or olive oil for the sausage & veggie stovetop meal. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Mango Smoothies, Egg Salad, and Sausage Stovetop Meal

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Boil your eggs and then get them cooling in the ice bath. 
  3. Start your sausage stovetop meal while your eggs cool. 
  4. Combine the rest of your egg salad ingredients and add the eggs when they are completely cooled. 
  5. Finish cooking the sausage stovetop meal. 
  6. Prep your smoothies while your sausage stovetop meal cools. 
  7. Assemble your prepped meals, put away your food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Horchata Onos and Vegan Lentil Taco Skillets for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Cook your lentils for the lentil taco skillet. 
  2. Continue to cook your lentil taco skillet. 
  3. While your skillet cooks, prepare your overnight oats. 
  4. Let your lentil taco skillet meal cool. 
  5. Assemble your prepped meals, put away your food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: April Member's Favorites Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Apple Breakfast Blondies: Change up the mix-ins to fit your taste and what kind of nuts, seeds, and dried fruits you have in your pantry. 

For the Blueberry Lemon Pancakes: Swap the blueberries for raspberries or strawberries if you like! You can also make these into waffles! 

For the Pike Place Inspired Chowder: Use green beans or broccoli in place of the asparagus, and feel free to use heavy cream or non-dairy milk in place of the coconut milk. 

For the Chickpea Pasta Salad: Switch up the veggies here to fit your taste, and use a different type of small pasta or orzo if you like. 

For the Chicken/Tempeh Tinga Tacos: See the recipe notes for sauce suggestions if you can’t find chipotle peppers in adobo sauce. Skip the cilantro if you don’t like it! 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use your favorite GF flour blend for the blondies, pancakes, and chowder. Use gluten-free pasta for the chickpea pasta salad, and corn or gluten-free tortillas for the tacos. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy butter or coconut oil for the blondies and pancakes, and non-dairy milk for the pancakes as well. You can skip the cheese or use non-dairy crumbled cheese for the pasta salad! 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Apple Breakfast Blondies, Pike Place Inspired Chowder, and Chickpea Pasta Salad here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  2. Roast your veggies for the pasta salad and get the water boiling for the pasta. 
  3. Once your veggies are done, lower the oven temp to 350 F / 175 C and prepare your batter for the blondies. 
  4. Get your blondies in the oven and continue to assemble your pasta salad. 
  5. Cook your chowder while the rest of your food cools. 
  6. Let all of your food cool completely and assemble into containers. 
  7. Put away your prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Blueberry Lemon Pancakes and Chicken/Tempeh Tinga Tacos for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Coat your protein in the spices and get it cooking, If you’re not making the veg version you will need to preheat your oven. 
  3. Make the sauce for the tacos and prepare the other ingredients while the protein cooks. 
  4. Once the tacos are done, make the pancakes and let them cool on a wire baking rack once they're done. 
  5. Assemble your food into containers, put away your prepped food, clean up, then relax!

title: Go-To Meal Preps
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Zucchini Carrot Chocolate Chip Pecan Bread: Instead of chocolate chips and pecans, you can use white chocolate chips, dried fruit, other nuts, or shredded coconut flakes if you like! 

For the Chocolate Peanut Butter Overnight Oats: If you don’t like chocolate and peanut butter, you can check out our many other flavors of overnight oats! Bananas or strawberries would be delicious in this. 

For the Banh Mi Inspired Rice Bowls: Feel free to use a different type of ground or shredded protein in these bowls. Leave the veggies raw if you don’t like pickled veggies! 

For the Tex Mex Mac N Cheese: Use your favorite burrito or nachos veggies in this. Add chorizo/soyrizo or ground meat if you like! 

For the Sweet Potato & Chickpea Avocado Wraps: You can use shredded rotisserie chicken instead of chickpeas, cooked broccoli or cauliflower instead of sweet potato, and swap in the greens of your choice! 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free flour for the confetti bread, and gluten-free oats for the ONOs. Use tamari or liquid aminos for the rice bowls, and GF pasta for the Tex Mex mac. Use your favorite GF tortillas for the wraps. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use dairy-free chocolate chips in the confetti bread, and dairy-free milk for the ONOs. Use your favorite non-dairy cheese and non-dairy milk for the mac. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Zucchini Carrot Bread, Banh Mi Bowls, and Sweet Potato Wraps here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 375 F / 190 C. 
  2. Make your zucchini bread batter and get it in the oven. 
  3. While your bread bakes, prep your quick pickled veggies and make your rice for the Banh Mi bowls. 
  4. Cook your protein for the bowls and take your bread out of the oven when it’s done. Increase the oven temp to 425 F / 220 C. 
  5. Get your sweet potatoes in the oven and then add the chickpeas. 
  6. Assemble your bowls while your sweet potatoes and chickpeas cool. Once they’re cooled completely you can assemble the wraps. 
  7. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

 Peanut Butter and Chocolate Overnight Oats and Tex-Mex Mac and Cheese for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Start your mac n cheese by cooking the veggies and pasta. 
  3. Make the sauce and mix everything together and then get your mac in the oven. 
  4. While your mac bakes, make your overnight oats. 
  5. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: 35-Minute or Less Recipes
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Nut Butter & Jelly Waffles: If nut butter and jam don’t sound great to you, check out some of our other great waffle recipes! If you have a nut allergy, sunflower seed butter is a great option here, otherwise use your favorite nut butter and jam flavor combination. 

For the Summer Squash Parmesan Fritters: You can use zucchini in place of yellow squash in these fritters, and you can use all-purpose flour in place of whole wheat. Use nutritional yeast in place of parmesan or non-dairy cheese if you like! 

For the Portuguese Bean Salad and Persian Couscous: Swap the black eyed peas for chickpeas, kidney beans, or white beans if you like. Use your favorite grain in place of couscous and change up the veggies to your preference. 

For the Mandarin Salad with Salmon/Tofu: Replace the salmon or tofu with the protein of your choice and follow the recommended cook times in the recipe notes. Use canned and drained mandarin oranges instead of fresh ones, and if you have a nut allergy you can skip the cashews and replace with something else crunchy like crispy wonton pieces or chips! 

For the 20-Minute Swiss Chard Pasta Skillet: Use a jar of marinara sauce in place of the crushed tomatoes if you have that on hand. Swap the swiss chard for kale or spinach! 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use your favorite GF flour blend for the waffles and fritters. Use quinoa, rice, or GF couscous in the bean salad. Swap the soy sauce for tamari and skip the fried chow mein noodles in the mandarin salad. Use your favorite GF pasta for the swiss chard pasta skillet. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk and butter for the waffles and pasta skillet. Swap the parmesan for nutritional yeast for the fritters and pasta skillet or use your favorite non-dairy parmesan instead. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Nut Butter & Jelly Waffles, the Portuguese Bean Salad, and the Swiss Chard Pasta here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Start the pasta skillet by cooking the pasta and then cooking the ground meat. 
  3. Continue cooking the pasta skillet. Start cooking your couscous for the Portuguese bean salad once you add your pasta to the skillet. 
  4. Let your pasta skillet cool and finish preparing your Portuguese bean salad. 
  5. Make the waffles and let them cool on a wire baking rack. 
  6. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Summer Squash Fritters and Mandarin Salads for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 400 F/ 200 C. 
  2. Bake your protein for the salads, then make the salad dressing. 
  3. Make your fritters while the protein for the salad cools. 
  4. Let your fritters cool on a wire baking rack. Assemble the salads into containers. 
  5. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: No-Reheat March Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Fluffy Savory Cheddar Muffins: Spice up these muffins by adding in some cayenne pepper or sliced jalapenos if you like heat. Add in chopped herbs or greens if you want! 

For the Pumpkin Spice Granola: Use pecans or a different type of nut if you have a favorite! Feel free to add in dried fruit or chocolate or white chocolate chips after baking and cooling.  

For the Green Tuna/Chickpea Pasta Salad: Change out the asparagus for broccoli or green beans. Add in other veggies like bell peppers, carrots, or radishes if you want. For the protein, you can use shredded chicken or cooked sliced veggie sausage instead. 

For the Spring Strawberry and Leek Salad: Feel free to pick up a rotisserie chicken for this meal to make it extra quick! Add in some avocado or croutons to this salad if you like. You can use apples or pears in place of strawberries. 

For the Meal Prep Teriyaki Poke Bowls: Change up the veggies by using your favorite fresh veggies in place of the carrots. Get creative with the toppings by checking out the list of recommended ones in the recipe notes! 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free flour in the muffins, and gluten-free oats for the granola. Use your favorite gluten-free pasta for the green pasta salad, and tamari in place of soy sauce for the poke bowls. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy shredded cheddar and non-dairy milk for the muffins. Use non-dairy butter for the granola, and non-dairy yogurt for the green pasta salad. Skip the cheese or use your favorite crumbly non-dairy cheese for the spring salad. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Cheddar Muffins, Strawberry Salads, and Green Tuna Pasta Salads here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C.
  2. Prepare the leeks and protein and get them in the oven. 
  3. While that cooks, make the dressing for the spring salads. Boil some water for the pasta salad. 
  4. Cook the pasta for the pasta salad and then make the sauce for it. 
  5. Let the leeks and protein cool and lower the oven temperature to 350 F /175 C. Make the batter for the muffins. 
  6. Get your muffins in the oven. Assemble the pasta salad. Let your muffins cool on a wire rack once they are done. 
  7. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Pumpkin Spice Granola and Poke Bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 350 F /175 C. 
  2. Make your quick pickled veggies and then get your protein marinating for the poke bowls. 
  3. Cook the noodles, sauce, then protein for the poke bowls. 
  4. While the cooked components for the bowls cool, bake your granola. 
  5. Let your granola cool and assemble your poke bowls. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: One-Pot March
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Loaded Vegan Banana Bread: Use all-purpose flour instead of whole wheat if you want. The add-ins are totally up to you here! Mix in chocolate chips, nuts, dried fruit, or all of the above! 

For the Baklava Overnight Oats: Add flax seeds in place of chia seeds and use maple syrup instead of honey. Use walnuts or pistachios in place of the almonds! 

For the Black Bean Soup: You can swap in your favorite veggies here to use up what you have! Add in some shredded chicken if you like and top with tortilla chips and shredded cheese. 

For the Cheesy Burrito Bowl Pasta: Choose the veggies based on your favorite burrito bowl veggies! Make sure to chop them small so they cook evenly. Add in some seasoned ground meat or shredded chicken if you like. 

For the Curried Sheet Pan Wrap: Feel free to add in some greens like spinach or kale to these wraps. Broccoli or bell peppers would be great in this. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free flour for the banana bread and gluten-free oats for the baklava overnight oats. Use your favorite GF pasta for the burrito bowl pasta, and gluten-free tortillas for the curried sheet pan wraps. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the banana bread and overnight oats. Pick up some non-dairy shredded cheese for the burrito bowl pasta. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Vegan Banana Bread, Black Bean Soup, and Curried Sheet Pan Wraps here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 350 F / 175 C. 
  2. Make your batter for the banana bread and get it in the oven. 
  3. While the banana bread bakes, prep your sheet pan wrap veggies on a sheet pan. 
  4. Start making your black bean soup. 
  5. Once the banana bread is done, turn up the oven to 400 F/ 200 C and bake your sheet pan veggies. 
  6. Continue to cook your soup and once it’s done separate into containers to cool. 
  7. Let your sheet pan veggies cool completely. Put away your other cooled and prepped food while you wait. Assemble your wraps, put them away, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Baklava Overnight Oats and Cheesy Burrito Bowl Pasta for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Start cooking your ground meat for the burrito bowl pasta. 
  3. Continue to cook your burrito bowl pasta, while it cooks, make your overnight oats. 
  4. Once your pasta is done cooking, let it cool completely and assemble into containers.
  5. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Member's Favorites - March
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Orange Creamsicle Waffles: Use store-bought orange juice instead of fresh and add in some dried cranberries if you want! If you want to buy orange juice, note that you will use it for the Bourbon-ish Chicken/Tofu as well! 

For the Fall Toasts: Choose your favorite seasonal veggies to roast instead of the squash and pick your favorite toppings to make this toast your own. See the recipe notes for lots of ideas! 

For the Bourbon-Ish Chicken/Tofu: Customize the veggies to your liking, and use noodles in place of rice if you like. 

For the Green Enchiladas: You can use a cooked rotisserie chicken instead of making your own for a quick and easy swap. Add in some extra veggies and top with avocado if you want. 

For the Salmon/Chickpeas with Lemon Orzo: Use a different protein like shrimp or tofu, and change up the veggies to use up what you already have if you want. Skip the olives if you are not a fan! 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free flour for the waffles, and your favorite gluten-free bread for the fall toasts. Use tamari in place of soy sauce in the bourbon-ish chicken/tofu, and use corn tortillas or GF tortillas for the enchiladas. Pick up some GF orzo or your favorite gluten-free short pasta for the lemon orzo. 

Dairy-free swaps: Pick up your favorite non-dairy yogurt to enjoy with the waffles, and use non-dairy milk and vegan butter for the batter. Skip the goat cheese for the fall toasts and feta for the lemon orzo or use your favorite crumbly non-dairy cheese, and use your favorite shredded non-dairy cheese for the enchiladas. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Orange Creamsicle Waffles, the Bourbon Chicken, and Green Enchiladas here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  2. Make your marinade for the protein for the enchiladas and then get it in the oven. 
  3. Start cooking your protein for the bourbon chicken/tofu on the stove and start cooking your rice. 
  4. Assemble your enchiladas and get them in the oven. Continue to cook the bourbon chicken/tofu. 
  5. Let your enchiladas and bourbon chicken/tofu cool while you make the batter for your waffles. Heat up your waffle iron. 
  6. Make your waffles and then let them cool on a wire baking rack. 
  7. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

 Meal Prep Toast and Salmon/Chickpea Lemon Orzo Salad for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  2. Get your squash in the oven and start cooking your onions to caramelize them nice and slowly for the fall toasts. 
  3. Cook your protein for the lemon orzo salad and then cook the orzo. 
  4. Prepare your eggs for the toast if using and assemble your lemon orzo salads. 
  5. Let your prepped ingredients for the toast cool completely, and assemble your lemon orzo salads into containers. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Bowl Recipes Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Spiced Apple Cider Granola:  If you can’t find apple cider, use apple juice instead! Add dried apples or any dried fruits you like to this. 

For the Sweet Potato Breakfast Hash: Use different potatoes and veggies if you like! Top with a fried egg right before serving if you want.  

For the Satay Bowls:  Swap out the chicken or tofu for a different protein, and change up the veggies to your liking. Make noodles or a different grain than rice if you like. 

For the Falafel and Chopped Salad Bowls: You can use whatever fresh herbs you like and customize the chopped veggies to the salad to fit your taste. 

For the Brussels Sprouts, Beets, & Barley Bowls: If you don’t want to use brussels sprouts and beets you can swap in your favorite veggies to roast. Use a different grain than barley if you like.  

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free oats and tortillas for the granola and breakfast hash. Use tamari in the satay bowls to make them gluten-free. Use GF flour for the falafel and use the GF grain of your choice instead of barley for the BBB bowls. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use vegan butter and your favorite non-dairy yogurt for the granola. Pick up some non-dairy feta cheese or make some tofu feta for the falafel bowls. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the apple cider granola, satay bowls, and brussels, beet & barley bowls here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  2. Marinate your protein for the satay bowls. Get your veggies in the oven for the BBB bowls. 
  3. Cook your grains for both your bowls. Add the sausage and shallots to the sheet pan for the BBB bowls. 
  4. Get your protein and veggies cooking for the satay bowls. Once everything is out of the oven, lower the temp to 325 F / 160 C. 
  5. Bake your granola, making sure to check it often so it does not burn.  
  6. While the granola cools, assemble your two different bowls and let everything cool completely. 
  7. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Sweet potato hash bowls and falafel chopped salads for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 350 F / 175 C. 
  2. Dry out the chickpeas in the oven and start cooking your sweet potatoes. 
  3. Make your falafel batter and refrigerate it until ready to use. Add the remaining ingredients to your sweet potato hash. 
  4. Make the dressing for the falafel salads, then fry your falafels. 
  5. Let your falafel and sweet potato hash cool completely. Assemble the sweet potato hash bowls into containers and store your falafel bowl ingredients buffet style. 
  6. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: New Member Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. See the “Recipe Notes” section below each individual recipe for even more swap ideas! 

For the No-Frills Banana Muffins: Replace the chocolate chips with whatever add-ins you like! Chopped walnuts, almonds, coconut flakes, or dried fruit would all be great in here. 

For the Strawberry Cheesecake Overnight Oats: You can use flax seeds or hemp hearts in place of chia seeds, and you can use fresh or frozen of your favorite berries in place of fresh strawberries. 

For the Spinach, Apple, and Carrot Salads: Customize this salad to your liking! Swap the spinach for arugula or spring mix, the apple for chopped pear or dried fruit, and the carrot for beet or zucchini ribbons. You can also swap the chicken for a pre-cooked rotisserie chicken to save even more time! 

For the Orzo and Zucchini Casserole: Use ground turkey or Beyond or Impossible meat instead of beef. Swap the zucchini for yellow squash, broccoli, or kale. 

For the Thai Coconut Noodle Soup: You can also use a pre-cooked rotisserie chicken in this meal, and you can swap the veggies to your liking. Use green curry paste if that’s what you have! 

Dairy-Free Swaps: Make sure to use your favorite non-dairy milk for the banana muffins and overnight oats, and non-dairy yogurt for the overnight oats as well. Skip the cheese or use non-dairy crumbly cheese or the salads, and non-dairy shreds for the casserole. 

Gluten-Free Swaps: Use your favorite GF flour blend for the muffins, and GF oats for the overnight oats. Make sure to use tamari in place of soy sauce for the salads, and use gluten-free orzo for the casserole. Use tamari and GF noodles for the Thai noodle soup. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the banana muffins, salads, and casserole, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 375 F /190 C. 
  2. Season your protein for the salads and then get it in the oven. While it bakes, prep your veggies for the salad and make the dressing. 
  3. Once the protein is done, lower the oven temperature to 350 F / 175 C. Make your muffin batter and get them in the oven. 
  4. Mix together your ingredients in your baking dish for your orzo casserole. If the muffins are not done you can bake this in the oven at the same time! 
  5. Your protein for the salads should be cooled by now so you can assemble your salads. Once your casserole and muffins are done baking, assemble them into containers. 
  6. Let all of your prepared food cool completely before putting it away in the fridge. 
  7. Put away your cooled,  prepped food, clean up your kitchen, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Strawberry cheesecake overnight oats and Thai coconut noodle soup for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! 
  2. Start your onions and garlic for the soup, then the protein.

  4. While the soup simmers, make your overnight oats. 
  5. Let your soup cool a little bit before transferring to containers. If you have extra, be sure to freeze it for later!

title: February Low Waste
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Blueberry Crisp: If you don’t have blueberries, use whatever fruit you like! Frozen fruit will also work here. 

For the Zucchini Fritters: Other hard veggies like potatoes, carrots, or broccoli would also work well grated in these fritters! Add in some shredded cheese or nutritional yeast if you like. 

For the Loaded Baked Potatoes: See the notes in this recipe for all the different topping ideas, you can get really creative with these and use up what you already have! 

For the Butternut Squash Soup: Customize your toppings by using a different bean, pita chips, or croutons on top instead. Add a swirl of the milk you used once in the containers for added creaminess. 

For the Creamy Garlic Pasta: Use whatever roasted veggies you like for this! Sweet potatoes, beets, and zucchini would all be great because you would use up the whole thing and keep it low waste. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free oats and flour for the blueberry crisp. Use gluten-free flour for the blueberry crisp, zucchini fritters, loaded baked potatoes, and creamy garlic pasta. Pick up your favorite GF pasta for the creamy garlic pasta. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use dairy-free butter and yogurt for the blueberry crisp, and dairy-free milk for the loaded baked potatoes, butternut squash soup, and creamy garlic pasta. Pick up some non-dairy parmesan or nutritional yeast for the creamy garlic pasta. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Blueberry Crisp, Loaded Baked Potatoes, and Butternut Squash Soup here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Separate your ingredients by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  2. Prep your potatoes and chickpeas and get them in the oven at the same time. 
  3. Start your butternut squash soup. Check on the chickpeas, and get the chicken/tofu and broccoli in the oven. 
  4. Make your sauce for the loaded baked potatoes and finish up your soup. Let your chickpeas, chicken/tofu, and broccoli cool while the potatoes finish in the oven. 
  5. Prep your blueberry crisp. When the potatoes are done, lower the oven temperature to 350 F / 175 C. 
  6. Get your blueberry crisp in the oven. Assemble your other meals while it bakes. 
  7. Let your blueberry crisp cool and assemble into containers. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Zucchini Fritters and Creamy Garlic Pasta with Veggies for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  2. Prep your zucchini and get your squash in the oven.
  3. Cook your pasta and sausage and then roast the rest of your veggies. 
  4. Make your sauce for the pasta while the pasta cooks and the veggies finish up. 
  5. Assemble your pasta into containers and let it cool, then cook your zucchini fritters.
