title: Minimal Cooking - February
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Cherry Berry Smoothie Cubes: Use raspberries in place of the cherries or strawberries in these smoothie cubes! You can skip the yogurt and add protein powder instead if you like.  

For the Lemon Blueberry Overnight Oats: You can use strawberries in place of blueberries, or leave out the lemon if you like and replace it with vanilla. Add in whatever toppings you want! 

For the Egg Salad: See the recipe notes for different variations of this egg salad to find which one sounds best to you. If you don’t want to use tofu for the vegan version, you can try mashed chickpeas or white beans instead. 

For the Broccoli Slaw Noodle Salad: Use tofu, tempeh, or a vegan chicken substitute in place of or in addition to the edamame for the veg version if you want! You can use a different type of long noodle in place of ramen if you like.  

For the Pizza Orzo Skillet: Choose the veggies you use in this based on your favorite pizza toppings! The same goes for the meat or protein, you can use your favorite sausage or pepperonis instead.

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free oats for the lemon blueberry overnight oats and your favorite gluten-free bread for the egg salad. Pick up some GF ramen for the broccoli slaw noodle salad and GF orzo or small noodles for the pizza skillet. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy yogurt and milk for the smoothies and overnight oats. You can use nutritional yeast or your favorite non-dairy shredded cheese in the pizza orzo skillet. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the blueberry overnight oats, egg salad, and pizza orzo skillet here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Boil your eggs for the egg salad. 
  3. While the eggs are boiling, start the protein for your pizza orzo skillet. 
  4. Cool your eggs in an ice bath while you continue to cook your orzo skillet. 
  5. Finish up the orzo skillet, then prepare the egg salad once the eggs are completely cool. 
  6. Let the orzo skillet cool and assemble your overnight oats. 
  7. Assemble your food into containers, put away your cooled prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Cherry berry smoothies and broccoli slaw noodle salad for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Boil your noodles for the noodle salad. 
  2. Cook your salmon or prep your edamame for the noodle salad. 
  3. While your noodles and protein cool, make your smoothie cubes. 
  4. Put away your smoothie cubes and assemble your broccoli slaw noodle salads. 
  5. Put away your prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

notes:

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Morning Glory Muffins: If you love this flavor profile but don’t want muffins, try the Morning Glory Oatmeal Bake instead! The add-ins are so customizable, swap in your favorite nuts, dried fruit, or chocolate chips in place of raisins and walnuts. 

For the Freezer-Friendly Breakfast Sandwiches: Add in your favorite omelet veggies to the egg bake to customize these sandwiches! Add some breakfast sausage or bacon if you like. 

For the Lasagna Soup: Use whatever veggies you like in place of or in addition to zucchini. Use white beans or more veggies in place of ground meat. 

For the Coconut Curry: Your favorite veggies will work great in this! Swap in more in addition to the cauliflower, carrots, and spinach. 

For the Sweet Potato & Black Bean Quesadillas: Add more cooked onion or another veggie in place of green bell pepper. Use a different potato or squash in place of sweet potatoes! 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free flour for the muffins, and gluten-free bread or English muffins for the breakfast sandwiches. Use GF lasagna noodles for the lasagna and GF tortillas for the quesadillas. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy butter for the muffins, non-dairy sliced cheese for the breakfast sandwiches, and non-dairy cream or milk for the lasagna soup. Use non-dairy shredded mozzarella for the lasagna soup and non-dairy shredded cheese of your choice for the quesadillas. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the morning glory muffins, lasagna soup, and quesadillas, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  2.  Prep your sweet potatoes for the quesadillas and get them in the oven. Then, add the remaining ingredients to the pan as well. 
  3. Start your lasagna soup. 
  4. Assemble your quesadillas with the roasted veggies and bake them. Once they are done, lower the temp to 350 F /175 C. 
  5. Prep your muffin batter. Continue to cook your soup. 
  6. Let your quesadillas cool on a wire baking rack. Dish out your soup into meal prep containers and let cool completely. Get your muffins in the oven. 
  7. Clean up while your muffins bake. Once they’re done, let them cool on a wire baking rack. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Breakfast sandwiches and coconut curry with veggies for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  2. Cook your rice for the curry. Prepare your protein for the curry. 
  3. Bake your eggs/tofu for the breakfast sandwiches. 
  4. Continue to cook your curry. Once the egg/tofu is done baking, let it cool completely. 
  5. Dish out your cooked curry and rice into containers to cool completely. Assemble your breakfast sandwiches. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: Freezer-Friendly Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Everything Bagel Waffles: Add some cayenne pepper or chili powder to the dry mix to add some spice to these waffles! Add some cooked and chopped bacon or breakfast sausage if you want, or chopped vegan breakfast “meat”, or some chopped greens. 

For the Strawberry Yogurt Muffins: Use blueberries, raspberries, or blackberries in place of strawberries! If you don’t want to use yogurt or non-dairy yogurt, use mashed banana.  

For the Tikka Masala: If you don’t want to use coconut milk, you can use whole milk or a creamy non-dairy milk like oat milk. Leave out the carrots or use a different veggie if you like! 

For the Red Lentil Soup: If you want to swap out the veggies in this, cauliflower, sweet potato, or squash would be great. 

For the Swiss Chard Pasta Skillet: Use ground turkey or vegan ground “meat” in place of the ground beef. Kale or spinach would be great swaps for the swiss chard. 

Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free flour for the waffles and muffins. You can use GF croutons for the soup or make your own using your favorite GF bread. Pick up some gluten-free pasta for the swiss chard pasta skillet. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk for the bagels, muffins, and pasta skillet. Use non-dairy butter for the muffins and pasta skillet. Pick up some non-dairy cream cheese for the bagels and non-dairy yogurt for the muffins and topping for the soup, or non-dairy cheese crumbles. Use nutritional yeast or non-dairy parmesan for the pasta skillet. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the strawberry lemon muffins, tikka masala, and red lentil soup here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 350 F / 175 C. 
  2. Start cooking your rice for the Tikka Masala while your oven preheats. Then, make the batter for the muffins. 
  3. Get your muffins in the oven and start your veggies for the soup. 
  4. Let your rice cool and start your protein and veggies for the Tikka Masala. 
  5. Continue to cook the soup and the Tikka Masala. Once the muffins are done, let them cool on a wire baking rack. 
  6. Assemble your soup and Tikka Masala into containers and cool at room temperature before moving to the fridge. 
  7. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Everything bagel waffles and swiss chard pasta for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Boil your water for the pasta. 
  2. Cook your pasta for the pasta skillet. Then, start cooking the protein. 
  3. Finish cooking the pasta skillet and assemble it into containers to cool. 
  4. Make the waffle batter and then heat up your waffle iron. Make your waffles. 
  5. Let the waffles cool on a wire backing rack. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax!

For the Green Smoothie: Use pineapple, papaya, or peaches in place of mango if you want to keep the vibrant green color! 

For the Banana Oatmeal Bake: Swap out the chopped dates and walnuts for your favorite dried fruit and nuts of your choice. Add in chocolate chips if you like! 

For the Roasted Gnocchi: Pick up your favorite pesto if you don’t want to make your own. If you use storebough pesto feel free to add some greens or extra veggies to this. 

For the Salmon Lettuce Cups: If you don’t want to use canned salmon, you can used canned tuna or make and flake some salmon. For the veg version, you can use crumbled tofu or mashed white beans. 

For the Chicken Ginger Rice Soup: Swap the greens of your choice in place of the spinach! Add in some extra root veggies if you want as well. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten free oats for the Banana Oatmeal Bake. Pick up some GF gnocchi, and if you can’t find it you can make your own with your favorite GF flour or make a different pasta on the side for the roasted gnocchi. Use tamari in place of soy sauce in the lettuce cups. 

Dairy-free swaps: Pick up your favorite non-dairy yogurt for the smoothies. Use non-dairy milk for the oatmeal bake and non-dairy parmesan or nutritional yeast for the roasted gnocchi.

Green smoothies and chicken ginger rice soup for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

notes:

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Berry Parfaits: Choose the berries of your choice for these parfaits! Feel free to pick up storebought granola if you like, and add in some extra add-ins like nuts, coconut flakes, or whatever you want! 

For the Pumpkin Scones: The glaze is optional but make it if you like a sweet breakfast. If you are not feeling pumpkin, try one of our other scone recipes to suit your taste! 

For the Garlic Eggplant Stir Fry: If you like spice, you can add some heat to this dish by adding chilis and sriracha! Add in some bell peppers or other crunchy veggies if you like. 

For the Mediterranean Warm Salad Bowls: Use quinoa or brown rice in place of the wild rice. If you don’t like arugula, feel free to use spinach or the leafy greens of your choice! 

For the Taco Salad Bowls: Roast your favorite veggies in place of the ones listed! Add some rice, quinoa, or turn the salad into a wrap to make it even more filling. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free oats for the parfaits, and gluten-free flour for the scones. Use tamari in place of soy sauce for the eggplant stir fry. Get gluten-free or corn tortilla chips for the taco salad bowls. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite dairy-free yogurt for the parfaits and Mediterranean bowls, and dairy-free butter and milk for the pumpkin scones. Use dairy-free cheese crumbles for the Mediterranean bowls and taco salad bowls, or make some tofu feta! 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the pumpkin scones, SweetGreen inspired salad, and garlic eggplant stir fry here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Prep the butter for your scones and preheat your oven to 375 F / 190 C. Prepare the eggplant. 
  3. Make the rice for the eggplant stir fry. Get your veggies and protein in the oven for the Sweetgreen bowls. 
  4. Start cooking your eggplant stir fry. While that cooks, make your vinaigrette for the Sweetgreen bowls. Once the veggies and protein are done and out of the oven, turn the temperature up to 400 F / 200 C. 
  5. Make your scones batter and finish cooking the eggplant stir fry. Let your cooked food cool. 
  6. Bake your scones! Assemble your salad bowls and put your eggplant stir fry in containers. 
  7. Let the scones cool, clean up, put away your cooled and prepped food, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Berry parfaits and Panera-inspired Mediterranean bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Make your marinade for your protein. Cook your rice.
  3. Preheat your oven to 325 F / 160 C. Cook the protein for your bowls. 
  4. Bake your granola. Let your cooked ingredients for your bowls cool. 
  5. Let your granola cool and assemble your bowls. Assemble your parfaits, leave the granola on the side if you want it crisp! 
  6. Put away your cooled, prepped food, clean up, then relax!

For the Soyrizo/Chorizo Breakfast Burritos: Add your favorite breakfast protein and omelet veggies to these burritos instead of the soyrizo/chorizo! Use frozen hashbrowns to make these burritos cook up even faster. 

For the Almond Joy ONOs: Swap the cocoa powder for chocolate or vanilla protein powder if you like. Use crushed walnuts, peanuts, or the nuts of your choice in place of almonds. If you are not feeling this flavor combo, make your favorite flavored overnight oats instead!

Dairy-free swaps: Skip the shredded cheese for the burritos and mac n cheese or use your favorite non-dairy kind. Use non-dairy milk and chocolate chips for the overnight oats.

Swap Notes

For the Quiche Lorraine: Swap the yellow onion for a leek in this quiche! Feel free to add some wilted spinach or kale if you like! If you are not feeling these quiche flavors, check out our Chorizo and Squash quiche instead! 

For the Cranberry Cream Cheese Crumble Bars: Canned cranberry sauce works great in these bars if you don’t want to make your own sauce. Raspberries would be great here in place of cranberries. 

For the One-Pot White Bean Soup: Skip the quinoa if you like! Add your favorite veggies in place of the ones listed in the soup. 

For the Southwestern Chili Cornbread Casserole: Use your favorite veggies in this chili! Top it with boxed cornbread mix to make it easier if you like.

For the Thai Red Curry Tacos: Use shredded rotisserie or leftover chicken here to make it even easier! Swap the cauliflower for tofu or tempeh, and use green or yellow curry paste in place of red! 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to pick up a gluten free pie crust for the quiche and gluten free or corn tortillas for the tacos! Use gluten-free flour for the crumble bars and cornbread casserole. 

Dairy-free swaps: Skip the shredded cheese or use your favorite non-dairy kind in the quiche and cornbread casserole. Use non-dairy butter for the quiche, crumble bars, and cornbread casserole. Pick up non-dairy cream cheese or silken tofu + a lemon for the crumble bars.

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Quiche Lorraine, Chilicornbread Casserole, and White Bean Soup With All The Veggies here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Separate your ingredients by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  2. Prep your pie crust. Cook your protein then onions for the quiche. 
  3. Start your chili. Mix up your ingredients for the quiche and get it in the oven. 
  4. Continue to cook your chili and make your batter for the cornbread while the quiche bakes. 
  5. Once the quiche is done, turn the oven down to 375 F / 190 C and get your chili cornbread casserole in the oven. Start your soup. 
  6. Let your quiche and cornbread casserole cool while you finish your soup. 
  7. Assemble your soup into containers and let it cool completely. Put away your cooled prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Cranberry Crumble Bars and Thai Curry Tacos for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! 
  2. Marinate your protein for the tacos, then make the cranberry sauce for the bars.
  3. Make the slaw for the tacos and start cooking the protein. Preheat your oven to 350 F / 175 C. Make the crumble and cream cheese layer for the bars.
  4. Assemble your bars and get them in the oven. Cook your protein for the tacos. 
  5. Make the avocado topping for the tacos while everything cools. Let your bars cool in the fridge after cooling on the counter for at least 30 minutes. 
  6. Put away your cooled prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: 30-Minute Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Very Berry Yogurt Smoothies: Feel free to use raspberries and blackberries in these smoothies! Use frozen berries to save time on chopping. 

For the Apple Cider Baked Donuts: Use apple juice plus extra cinnamon if you don’t have apple cider! Use a flax or chia egg to make this vegan. 

For the Spiced Lentils with Kale: Green or brown lentils will work in place of red but will yield a different texture. Spinach or the greens of your choice will work well in place of kale! 

For the BLTs with Avocado: Use deli meat or the protein of your choice in place of bacon, and swap the butter lettuce for your favorite lettuce or greens! 

For the Dan Dan Inspired Noodles: Add in your favorite leafy greens while cooking your noodles to blanch them! Use spaghetti or another type of long noodle if that’s what you have on hand. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free flour and bread for the apple cider donuts and the BLTs. Use your favorite gluten-free ramen noodles for the Dan Dan inspired noodles. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy yogurt for the smoothies, non-dairy milk for the smoothies and donuts, and non-dairy butter for the donuts. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the berry smoothies, spiced red lentils, and BLT's here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prepare your ingredients by recipe to stay organized. 
  2. Prepare your protein for the BLTs and make the rice for the spiced lentils 
  3. Prep your veggies for the BLTs and then start cooking the lentils. 
  4. While the lentils cook, make your smoothies. 
  5. Put away your prepped ingredients for the sandwiches and separate your spiced lentils and rice into containers. 
  6. Put away your prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Apple cider doughnuts and dan dan inspired noodles for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 350 F / 175 C.  
  2. Boil your water for the noodles and then make your batter for the donuts. 
  3. Cook your protein and veggies for the noodles. Get your donuts in the oven. 
  4. Finish making your noodles. Let your baked donuts cool on a wire rack. 
  5. Put away your prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: Low Waste Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Fall Apple Crumble Bars: Use your favorite type of apples in these bars! Granny Smith or Honeycrisp would work best because they are firm and tart. If you have other fruit and want to use up, follow the recipe for the Blackberry Crumble Bars instead. 

For the Vanilla Maple Almond Granola: Swap the almonds for nuts of your choice if you have others on hand. Walnuts, pistachios, and peanuts would all be great. Use honey in place of maple syrup as the sweetener.  

For the Balsamic Harvest Bowl: Use the protein of your choice in place of chicken or tempeh if you already have another protein in your fridge or pantry! Your favorite leafy greens will work in place of kale and quinoa or farro will be great in place of wild rice. 

For the Pumpkin Spinach Curry: If you are using kale for the balsamic harvest bowls, you can use the rest of it here instead of buying spinach! Use up any veggies you may have in your fridge or freezer to prevent waste. 

For the Creamy Garlic Pasta: Grab a different squash if you don’t want to use acorn, but make sure it’s still small so you can use up the whole thing. Swap the head of broccoli for a bunch of asparagus or two whole bell peppers. Use whatever short pasta you have on hand! 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to grab gluten-free flour for the crumble bars and creamy garlic pasta. Use gluten-free oats for the crumble bars and granola. Grab some tamari for the curry and gluten-free pasta for the creamy garlic pasta! 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite dairy-free butter for the crumble bars and creamy garlic pasta. Skip the cheese in the harvest bowls or pick up your favorite non-dairy crumbly cheese and a non-dairy shredded cheese for the creamy garlic pasta. Make sure to use non-dairy milk for the creamy garlic pasta. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Fall crumble bars, pumpkin spinach curry, and balsamic harvest bowls here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prepare your ingredients by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 400 F (200 C).
  2. Prepare your protein and sweet potatoes for the harvest bowls and get them in the oven. 
  3. Start cooking your rice for the curry and the harvest bowls. Marinate or bake your protein for the harvest bowls depending on if you are using chicken or tofu. 
  4. When the protein and sweet potatoes are done baking, lower the oven temp to 350 F (175 C) and make your crumble bars. 
  5. Bake the bars and cook the rest of the components for your curry. Make your dressing for the harvest bowls while that cooks. 
  6. Let your ingredients cool then assemble your harvest bowls and dish out your curry into containers. Let your crumble bars cool on the counter for at least 30 minutes then transfer to the fridge to cool overnight. 
  7. Put away all your prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Vanilla Almond Granola and Creamy Garlic Pasta for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 325 F (160 C). 
  2. Make your granola and get it in the oven. Make sure to check on it and stir it often to prevent burning! 
  3. Start your boiling water for the pasta and cook your sausage. When the granola is done, up the temp to 400 F (200 C). 
  4. Roast your veggies for the pasta and make the sauce. Mix everything together once the sauce is done. 
  5. Let your granola and pasta cool and then dish out into containers. 
  6. Put away your prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: Delicious Go-To Recipes Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Coffee Coconut Breakfast Cookies: You can leave out the coffee in these and add more coconut milk for a caffeine-free variation. Use sweetened shredded coconut for a sweeter cookie and feel free to add in extra nuts if you like! 

For the Cranberry Orange Muffins: Swap fresh cranberries for frozen, dried, or even a swirl of cranberry sauce if you still have some you need to use up! Use fresh oranges instead of orange juice if you have oranges on hand. 

For the One Pot Creamy Cajun Pasta: Use your favorite bell peppers and crunchy veggies in here! Reduce or omit the spice for a non-spicy pasta, and feel free to try this with orzo or your favorite short pasta. 

For the Saucy Lentil Quesadillas: Try black beans or garbanzo beans instead of lentils. Use up any extra veggies you may have in here!  

For the Satay Bowls With Rice and Stir Fry Veggies: Make this with your favorite grain or noodle in place of rice. Swap the veggies for a bag of frozen stir-fry veggies to save time and chopping if you want! 

Gluten-free swaps: Use GF oats for the breakfast cookies! Make sure to use gluten-free flour for the breakfast cookies and muffins. Grab your favorite GF pasta for the Cajun pasta, and gluten-free tortillas for the quesadillas. Don’t forget tamari instead of soy sauce for the satay bowls. 

Dairy-free swaps: 

Grab your favorite dairy-free chocolate chips for the breakfast cookies and dairy-free butter for the muffins. Use your favorite dairy-free shredded cheese, cream cheese, and parmesan or nutritional yeast for the quesadillas and Cajun pasta.

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Cranberry Orange Muffins, Creamy Cajun Pasta, and Lentil Quesadillas here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Separate your ingredients by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 400 F (200 C). 
  2. Make your batter for the cranberry muffins. Blend the tomato mixture and start cooking the lentils for the quesadillas. 
  3. Bake the muffins. While the muffins bake, cook your veggies for the quesadillas. 
  4. Assemble and bake your quesadillas, and then start making your Cajun pasta. 
  5. Cool the muffins and quesadillas on a wire baking rack.
  6. Assemble the pasta in containers and let it cool completely. 
  7. Put away your cooled prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Coconut Breakfast Cookies and Satay Bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 350 F (175 C). 
  2. Make your marinade for the protein for your satay bowls. 
  3. Brew or mix your coffee for the breakfast cookies and start the rice for the bowls. 
  4. Mix together your batter for the cookies and get them in the oven. 
  5. Cook the protein and veggies for the bowls. 
  6. Let the cookies cool on a wire baking rack and assemble the satay bowls into containers and let them cool completely. 
  7. Put away your cooled prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: Use Your Leftovers Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Apple Crisp: If you have leftover apple, pumpkin, or pecan pie, you could mix this into the apple crisp! Throw any extra cranberries in with the apples as well. 

For the Fall Toasts: Leftover sides like roasted sweet potatoes, butternut squash, or other seasoned roasted veggies would all be delicious on top of toast. Add leftover cranberry sauce on top for a sweet touch! 

For the Shepherd's Pie: This is a perfect way to use up leftover mashed potatoes! You could use leftover turkey in the base instead of ground beef or lentils and give it a pot pie feel. 

For the Fall Cobb Salad: This salad is the perfect place to use up any leftover snack veggies or fresh greens! Any sauce-free roasted veggies would also be a great addition here. 

For the Thanksgiving Wraps: The perfect leftovers meal! You can use up leftover mashed potatoes, sweet potatoes, or butternut squash. Add in the leftover protein like turkey, ham, or vegan roast. Gravy would be great instead of cranberry sauce for a wrap with a more savory feel. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free oats for the apple crisp. Use your favorite gluten-free bread for the fall toasts and GF tortillas for the thanksgiving wraps. Swap in tamari for soy sauce in the fall cobb salads! 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite dairy-free butter for the apple crisp and shepherd’s pie. Swap in your favorite non-dairy yogurt for the apple crisp and non-dairy cheese for the fall toasts and thanksgiving wraps! 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Apple Crisp, Shepherd's pie, and Fall cobb salads here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Separate your ingredients by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 425 F / 225 C. 
  2. If not using leftovers, bake your squash and protein for the cobb salads. Start your mashed potatoes for the shepherd’s pie. 
  3. Once the squash is done roasting, lower the oven temp to 350 F / 175 C. Mix together your apple crisp ingredients and get it in the oven. 
  4. Cook your veggies and lentils or meat for the shepherd’s pie. Make the dressing for the salads. 
  5. Once the apple crisp is done, up the temp to 400 F / 200 C and bake your shepherd’s pie. 
  6. Assemble your salads with your cooled ingredients. Assemble your apple crisp and shepherd’s pie into containers and let them cool completely. 
  7. Put away your cooled and prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Fall toast and Thanksgiving Wraps for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C. 
  2. Roast your squash, sweet potatoes, and chicken or tofu at the same time if not using leftovers. 
  3. Caramelize the onions for the fall toast and make the cranberry sauce for the wraps. 
  4. Prep your eggs for the toast and kale for the wraps. 
  5. Let all your cooked ingredients cool completely, then assemble your wraps and assemble your prepped toast ingredients into containers. 
  6. Put away your cooled and prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: Throw It Together Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Bagel Boats: Use your favorite breakfast veggies instead of spinach and mushrooms! Tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, and kale would all be great in this. Swap the prosciutto for your favorite breakfast protein like bacon, sausage, or tempeh bacon! 

For the Nostalgic Peanut Butter And Jelly ONOs: Make your favorite ONOs instead! We have so many different flavors, pick your favorite or choose based on what you have on hand. The Horchata, Chocolate Chia, Pumpkin Spice, and Cinnamon Oat Cookie are all also easy flavors. 

For the Easy Tortilla Soup: Swap in jalapeno, green or red bell peppers, or zucchini for the yellow bell pepper. Add shredded jackfruit to the veggie version or switch up the shredded chicken in the meat version with ground meat of your choice! 

For the Dump & Bake Pasta: Use whatever veggies you have on hand in here instead! If you want to switch up the protein, keep in mind you will need to cook it separately so there will be an extra step there. 

For the Broccoli Slaw Noodle Salad: Spaghetti or rice ramen would work well in this cold noodle dish. Switch up the protein and use precooked chicken or tofu to make this super fast. Use your favorite store-bought dressing to make this even quicker. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to pick up gluten-free bagels, oats, short pasta, and rice noodles for this week! The tortilla soup is essentially gluten-free but make sure the tortilla chips for topping are gluten-free!   

Dairy-free swaps: You will need non-dairy cheese for the bagel boats, tortilla soup, and dump & bake pasta! Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the overnight oats. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Bagel Boats, Dump and Bake Pasta, and Tortilla Soup here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 375 F (190 C). 
  2. Assemble your Dump & Bake Pasta and get it in the oven! 
  3. While your pasta bakes, start cooking your Tortilla Soup. 
  4. Prep your bagels for the Bagel Boats while the pasta finishes baking. When it's done turn up the temperature to 400 F (200 C). 
  5. Bake your Bagel Boats. When they're done, let them cool on a wire baking rack. 
  6. Assemble your prepped food into containers and let it cool completely. Put your food away, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

PB&J Overnight Oats and Broccoli Slaw Noodle Salad for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Cook your noodles and protein for the Broccoli Slaw Noodle Salad. 
  3. Make the dressing while that cooks. 
  4. Assemble your PB&J Overnight Oats. Let your salad ingredients cool before assembling. 
  5. Assemble your cooled ingredients into containers for the Noodle Salads. Put your food away, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Freezer Stash Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Pumpkin Coffee Smoothies: Swap the canned pumpkin with roasted delicata, butternut, or acorn squash if you don't want to use canned pumpkin. Use cold brew or instant coffee in place of brewed coffee. 

For the Zucchini Carrot Chocolate Chip Pecan Bread: Replace the pecans and chocolate chips with walnuts, dried cranberries, raisins, pumpkin seeds, and/or white chocolate chips! Make the loaf in a muffin tin instead of Confetti Bread muffins. 

For the Loaded Chorizo/Soyrizo & Poblano Chili: Swap the veggies in this chili with almost any leftovers you may have! You can use ground beef, turkey, or veggie ground meat instead of the chorizo/soyrizo for a different flavor. 

For the Green Enchiladas: Use different greens in place of spinach, and pinto or garbanzo beans in place of black beans. For a red sauce option, you can check out our other enchilada recipes! 

For the Japanese Curry Rice: Change up the protein in this by using pork, beef, tofu, or tempeh. Switch up the veggies by using kabocha squash, cauliflower, or mushrooms. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free oats for the smoothies and GF tortillas for the enchiladas. Use your favorite all-purpose GF flour mixture for the bread and the curry. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the smoothies and non-dairy butter for the bread and curry. Use your favorite non-dairy shredded cheese for the enchiladas and chili. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Zucchini Pecan Bread, Green Enchiladas, and Chorizo Chili here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 375F/190C. 
  2. Make the batter for your bread and get it in the oven. If making the omnivore enchiladas, get your chicken in the oven as well. 
  3. Start cooking the chili and the veggie bean mixture for the enchiladas while your bread bakes. 
  4. Get your enchiladas in the oven. 
  5. Let your chili and bread cool then assemble into containers. Once your enchiladas are done, let those cool as well before assembling them into containers. 
  6. Put your cooled and assembled food away, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Pumpkin Smoothies and Japanese Curry Rice for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! 
  2. Make the rice for your curry. 
  3. Start cooking the veggies for the curry. 
  4. While the curry cooks, prep your smoothie bags or make your smoothie cubes. 
  5. Let your curry cool, then assemble into containers.

title: One-Pot Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Loaded Banana Bread: Add in your favorite banana bread mix-ins! Chocolate chips, walnuts, macadamia nuts, white chocolate chips, dried cranberries, raisins, pumpkin seeds, or flax seeds would all be great added to the mix! You can bake this bread into muffins instead of a loaf if you like! 

For the Strawberry Cheesecake Overnight Oats: Add your favorite fruit instead of strawberries! Blackberries, blueberries, or raspberries would be delicious. Mashed banana or even canned pumpkin would be so good in this as well! 

For the Creamy White Bean Soup: This soup is so adaptable to what you have on hand! Use your favorite white beans in place of cannellini and any greens or herbs you may have on hand instead.  

For the One-Pot Southwestern Rice Skillet: Use whatever veggies you have on hand instead! Broccoli, squash, onions, mushrooms, peppers, or tomatoes would be great in this. You can make swaps to the veggies but be sure to use white rice if you want to keep the cook times around the same. If you want to use a different rice or pasta we suggest cooking it on the side instead.

For the Curried Sheet Pan Wraps: Swap the sweet potatoes out for regular potatoes or butternut squash! Add in your favorite greens or other cooked veggies if you like. 

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free flour for the Loaded Banana Bread. Use your favorite gluten-free wraps for the  Curried Sheet Pan Wraps. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk for the Loaded Banana Bread and Strawberry Cheesecake Overnight Oats, along with non-dairy yogurt for the oats. Grab your favorite non-dairy shredded or skip it for the One-Pan Southwestern Rice Skillet. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com

Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Loaded Vegan Banana Bread, Creamy White Bean Soup, and Southwestern Rice Skillet here's how to get it done fast:

Strawberry Cheesecake Onos and Curried Sheet Pan Wraps for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

title: Low Waste Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Zucchini Bread Chocolate Chip Waffles: If you have carrots on hand, you can shred them and swap them in place of the zucchini. Add chopped nuts, crushed candy, or coconut flakes in place of chocolate chips. 

For the Peanut Butter Banana Crumble Bars: Make either the Blackberry Crumble Bars or Fall Pumpkin Apple Crumble bars instead! If you still want to go the peanut butter route, use the berry layer from the Blackberry Crumble Bars and make PB&J bars! 

For the Fall Veggie Ramen: Use whatever veggies you have on hand in place of the butternut squash. If you have extra zucchini from the waffles you can use that here as well! Use your favorite protein in place of the chicken and add tofu, tempeh, edamame, or extra veggies to the veg versions! 

For the Lemon Garlic Orzo: The veggies in this meal are also super customizable! Use up your leftover veggies in place of the broccoli. Instead of sausage or veggie sausage, cook your favorite protein on the side and add it in at the end. 

For the Butternut Squash Enchilada Bake: This is a great way to use up the rest of the squash from the ramen if you had a lot of squash! Swap the crushed tomatoes for canned diced tomatoes if you have those on hand. Use pinto or garbanzo beans if you have those in your pantry! Add any leftover protein of your choice in place of the beans if you have it. 

Gluten-free swaps: Use your favorite gluten-free flour blend in the waffles and crumble bars. Make sure to pick up gluten-free ramen noodles and orzo. Use gluten-free oats for the crumble bars and gluten-free or corn tortillas for the enchilada bake.

Dairy-free swaps: Make sure to use your favorite non-dairy milk in the waffles, crumble bars, and ramen. Use non-dairy cheese or nutritional yeast for the orzo and enchilada bake! 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Zucchini Waffles, Fall Veggie Ramen, and Lemon Garlic Orzo Skillet here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Make the broth for the ramen. Preheat your oven to 400 F (200 C). 
  3. Bake the squash. Start the sausage and then the veggies for the orzo skillet. 
  4. Cook the remaining veggies and protein (if using) for the ramen. 
  5. Finish up the orzo skillet and the ramen. 
  6. Make your waffle batter while the orzo skillet and ramen cool. 
  7. Let your waffles cool on a wire baking rack. Put away your cooled food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Peanut Butter Crumble Bars and Butternut Squash Enchilada Bake for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

title: Budget Friendly Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Pumpkin Pancakes: Instead of buying canned pumpkin, use mashed ripe banana, mashed sweet potato, or mashed squash of your choice if you have any of those on hand. Delicata squash would be particularly good in these pancakes. 

For the Banana Walnut Cinnamon Granola: If you don't have bananas or walnuts, check out our other granola recipes to see what fits your pantry and produce to use up what you have! You can use also use any nuts instead of walnuts. 

For the Green Tuna/Chickpea Salad Pitas: Use sliced bread and make Green Tuna/Chickpea Salad sandwiches instead! Bonus if you can also use the bread on the side with your soup so you don't have to buy pita and bread. If you have leftover herbs or crunchy veggies in your fridge, use up those! 

For the Broccoli Rice Casserole: Any leftover veggies you enjoy with rice will be a great swap for the broccoli. Check out what's on sale too to see what will be a good swap. If you don't have rice, orzo would be a great swap if you have it in your pantry. 

For the Hearty Lentil Tomato Soup: This meal is almost entirely made of pantry ingredients! If you have other canned tomatoes on hand like crushed or whole, use those instead. Use the same herbs from the Green Tuna/Chickpea Salad Pitas instead of basil. 

Gluten-free swaps: Pick up your favorite gluten-free pitas or sliced bread for the Green Tuna/Chickpea Salad Pitas and the Hearty Lentil Tomato Soup. Use gluten-free flour in the Pumpkin Pancakes and Broccoli Rice Casserole. Use gluten-free oats in the Granola.  

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk in the Pumpkin Pancakes and Broccoli Rice Casserole. Make sure to get non-dairy yogurts for the granola or enjoy it with the non-dairy milk you get for the other recipes. Get your favorite non-dairy shredded cheese for the Broccoli Rice Casserole or try the vegan version! 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Pumpkin Pancakes, Green Tuna Pitas, and Broccoli Rice Casserole here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Cook the rice and then prepare the protein for the Broccoli Rice Casserole. 
  3. Prepare the broccoli and then cheese sauce for the Casserole. Preheat your oven to 350 (180 C). 
  4. While the Broccoli Rice Casserole bakes, make your dressing for the Green Tuna/Chickpea Salad Pitas. 
  5. Finish up the salad for the Pitas and then prepare your Pumpkin Pancakes batter. 
  6. Make the pancakes while the Broccoli Rice Casserole cools. 
  7. Let your pancakes cool on a wire rack while you assemble your prepared food into containers. 
  8. Put everything away, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

 Banana Granola and Lentil Tomato Soup for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Start cooking your veggies for the Soup. Preheat your oven to 300 F (150C). 
  3. Continue to cook your Soup while you mix together your Granola. 
  4. Bake the Granola and check on it while you finish your Soup. 
  5. Let everything cool and then assemble into containers. 
  6. Put everything away, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: Around the World Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Shakshuka: If you have more veggies lying around, feel free to add them in! Red bell pepper, zucchini, swiss chard, and eggplant would be my first choices. Adding some feta on top is delicious!

For the Okonomiyaki: Go crazy with the toppings here! Pork belly, deli meat, sliced beef, or even calamari would be great. You can sub green cabbage for Napa cabbage if needed. 

For the Salad Niçoise: You can really add any roasted veggies you enjoy into this salad! You can also add a grain such as rice, quinoa, or farro to make it more filling. 

For the Banh Mi Bowls: Any ground meat will work for this meal! You can swap tofu for ground “meat” crumbles as well. If you don't enjoy pickled veggies, simply leave them raw!

For the Tortilla Soup: Use ground beef, turkey, or jackfruit as the protein instead of chicken. Add jalapeno, red onion, any color bell pepper, or zucchini as well!

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to grab gluten-free bread to enjoy with your shakshuka! Use an all-purpose gluten-free flour for the okonomiyaki. Sub soy sauce for liquid aminos or tamari in the banh mi bowls. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use vegan mayo for the okonomiyaki and the banh mi bowls. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Shakshuka, Salad Niçoise and Banh Mi Bowls here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat your oven to 375 F (190 C). Make your quick pickled veggies for the Banh Mi Bowls. 
  3. Bake your potatoes and prepare your protein for the Salad Niçoise.
  4. Prepare the rice, sauce, and protein for the Banh Mi Bowls. 
  5. Finish up cooking the ingredients for the Salad Niçoise and Banh Mi Bowls. 
  6. Cook the Shakshuka while your other meals cool before assembly. 
  7. Assemble your cooled meals into containers, put the food away, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Okonomiyaki and Tortilla Soup for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Start cooking your Tortilla Soup.
  3. While the soup cooks, make the batter and then cook the Okonomiyaki. 
  4. Prepare the optional toppings for your soup. 
  5. Let your cooked food cool, assemble into containers, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: Minimal Ingredient Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Pumpkin Muffins: You can either keep them as is or add chocolate chips, nuts, dried fruit, or nut butter!

For the Zucchini Fritters: Add some shredded cheese to this batter to make these fritters extra tasty. You can also add other shredded veggies such as carrots, sweet potatoes, regular potatoes, and onion!

For the Enchiladas: Feel free to add extra protein to these with shredded chicken, ground turkey or ground beef. You can also swap black beans for a different type of bean. Add more veggies such as mushrooms, bell pepper, sweet potato, shredded carrots, corn,etc.

For the Ginger Soup: Add more veggies such as celery, turnips, or even mushrooms. You can add some chopped tofu or white beans if you are making the vegetarian version to replace the chickpeas.

For the Salad: Use a different squash such as delicata, pumpkin, acorn, or winter if you can't find butternut. Sweet potatoes could also work. If you don't love quinoa, a different grain such as farro or wild rice would be great.

Gluten-free swaps: Use all-purpose GF flour and GF oats for the pumpkin muffins. You will also need gluten-free flour for the zucchini fritters. You will need gluten-free tortillas for the enchiladas. 

Dairy-free swaps: Make sure to grab vegan butter and your favorite non-dairy milk for the pumpkin muffins. You will need dairy-free shredded cheese for the enchiladas. Swap feta for your favorite non-dairy cheese in the butternut squash salad.

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Pumpkin Muffins, Veggie Enchiladas and Ginger Soup here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat your oven to 325 F (160 C) and start sweating your veggies for the Ginger Soup. 
  3. Make your Pumpkin Muffin batter while you continue to cook your soup. Get the muffins in the oven. 
  4. While the muffins bake and your soup continues to cook, cook your veggies for the enchiladas. 
  5. Once the muffins are done, increase the oven temperature to 400 F (200 C) and get your enchiladas in the oven. Let your muffins cool on a wire baking rack. 
  6. Let the soup and enchiladas cool completely and then assemble into containers. 
  7. Put away your cooled prepped food, clean up, then relax!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Zucchini Fritters and Butternut Squash Salad for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Cook the butternut squash and quinoa for your salads. 
  3. While those cook, make your fritter batter and start your fritters. 
  4. Let your squash and quinoa cool while you finish up the fritters. Let them cool on a wire baking rack when done. 
  5. Assemble your salads and put away your cooled fritters. Clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Takeout-Inspired Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Scones: The icing is optional for the scone recipe! If you do not make it, be sure to add ¼ cup sugar to the mix!!

For the Wraps: Swap the veggies listed for kale, swiss chard, roasted red peppers, or regular tomatoes. Use goat cheese, blue cheese, or gorgonzola instead of feat.

For the Noodle Stir Fry: Use red pepper flakes instead of dried chiles for less spice. Swap the shrimp for chicken, beef or pork. Use edamame or tempeh to replace the tofu.

For the Salads: Add even more veggies such as celery, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, shredded carrot, and peas. You can use your favorite store-bought dressing instead of making it!

For the Shake Shack Bowls: If you don't want to make your own fries, use frozen fries, tater tots, or hashbrowns. Use any type of ground meat you enjoy or have on hand! Shredded chicken, “meat” crumbles, and chickpeas would all work as well.

Gluten-free swaps: Use an all-purpose GF flour for the scones. You will need GF tortillas or lavash for the spinach feta wraps. Use liquid aminos or tamari instead of soy sauce for the stir fry. Get gluten-free tortilla chips to add some crunch to your southwestern salads. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk and vegan butter for the scones. You will also need to make a heavy cream sub with vegan butter and non-dairy milk as well, instructions are in the recipe! Use your favorite crumbly vegan cheese in the spinach “feta” wraps and for the salads. You will need non-dairy milk and yogurt if you are making the southwest salad dressing. Grab vegan mayo for the burger sauce in the shake shack bowls!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Pumpkin Scones, Kung Pao Stir Fry, and Southwestern Salads here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready!  Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. 
  2. Prep the butter for the scones and get it in the freezer, then make your sauce for the Kung Pao stir fry. 
  3. Make your scone dough and refrigerate it while you cook your veggies for the stir fry. 
  4. Shape your scones and freeze them while you finish cooking the stir fry. Start the protein for your salads and preheat your oven to 400 F (200 C). 
  5.  Let your stir fry cool while you make the dressing for the salad. Get your scones in the oven. 
  6. Assemble your salads and stir fry into containers and let the stir fry cool completely. Let the scones cool on a wire baking rack before putting away. 
  7. Put away your prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Spinach Feta Wraps and Shake Shack Burger Bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 400 F (200 C). 
  2. Soak the potatoes for your fries while you prep your egg or tofu mixture for the wraps. 
  3. Bake your fries and egg or tofu mixture at the same time. Start cooking the protein for the burger bowls while those bake. 
  4. Cook the spinach and tomatoes for the wraps and make the burger sauce for the bowls. 
  5. Let all of your prepped elements cool completely, then assemble the wraps. Store the burger bowl components separately. 
  6. Put away your prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: 9.22.21 Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Muffins: If you don't love carrot and apple, you can swap them for zucchini, pear, banana, butternut squash, and sweet potato. Switch up the add-ins to ones that you prefer or already have on hand!

For the Waffles: Adding bacon or ham would be delicious in these. You can also add jalapeno or cayenne for a little spice!

For the Curry: Feel free to add any veggies you enjoy or need to use up in this! Swap the protein for beef, shrimp, pork, or ground turkey. Use green curry paste if you can't find red or already have it!

For the Soup: If you want to add more protein, shredded chicken or jackfruit would be delicious! Make sure to taste as you go with this one to control the spice levels! 

For the Orzo: If you do not like olives, feel free to leave them out. Sub salmon/chickpeas for shrimp, chicken, tofu, seitan, or white beans.

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use GF flour for the morning glory muffins and the waffles. Swap soy sauce for liquid aminos in the curry. Make sure to grab GF orzo, or any short GF pasta.

Dairy-free swaps: Use vegan butter for the muffins. Use non-dairy milk for the waffles. Grab a non-dairy cheese to add to the orzo dish!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Morning Glory Muffins, Mango Curry, and Black Bean Soup here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Get your kitchen clean and ready!  Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.  Preheat your oven to 350 F (175 C). 
  2. Make your rice for the curry. While that cooks, mix your batter for the muffins. 
  3. Get your muffins in the oven. Get the protein for your curry cooking while they bake. 
  4. Start the soup while you finish cooking the curry. 
  5. Let the muffins cool on a wire rack once they are done. Assemble the curry into containers to cool while you finish up the soup. 
  6. Once the soup is done, assemble that into containers and let it cool.

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Savory Waffles and Salmon/Chickpea Orzo for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! 
  2. Make your salmon or chickpeas for the orzo, then start the orzo. 
  3. Prep your waffle batter and heat your waffle iron. 
  4. Make your waffles and let them cool on a wire rack. 
  5. Finish up your salmon/chickpea orzo salad and assemble it into containers. 
  6. Put away your cooled food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Fall Favorites Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Fall Bars: If you do not want to use canned pumpkin, you can swap this out for pumpkin butter, apple butter, applesauce, or your favorite spread that pairs well with apples!

For the Breakfast Burritos: If you don't have hash browns, tater tots would be a delicious addition to these burritos! Also feel free to add any leftover veggies you have.

For the Chili: Use beer instead of hard cider. If you don't want to use any alcohol, use apple cider, meat stock, or beef cubes!

For the Salad: Swap the chickpeas out for chicken breast if you eat meat, tempeh or tofu! If you don't like blue cheese, you can use goat cheese, feta or gorgonzola instead.

For the Pasta: Chickpeas or pinto beans would work instead of white beans. Add veggie "meat" crumbles if you want! If you eat meat you can add chicken, ground turkey/beef, or chicken sausage.

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use GF oats and flour for the Fall bars. Grab GF tortillas for the breakfast burritos. Sub farro for quinoa in the beet salads. Use your favorite GF pasta for the white bean balsamic pasta!

Dairy-free swaps: You will need vegan butter for the Fall bars. Use your favorite non-dairy cheese for the breakfast burritos and the cider chili. Use a crumbly non-dairy cheese to go in your salad as well! You will need non-dairy milk, vegan butter, and nutritional yeast for the white bean pasta!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Fall Crumble Bars, Cider Chili, and Kale Beet Salads here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Preheat your oven to 425 F (220 C). 
  2. Prepare your beets for the salads and get them in the oven. Then, prepare your apples for the bars. 
  3. Get your chili going and finishing assembling your bars. Once the beets are done, lower the oven temperature to 350 F (175 C) and get your bars in the oven. 
  4. Cook the farro for the salads and keep working on your chili. 
  5. Let the farro cool so you can assemble the salads. Once the chili is done, assemble it into containers and let it cool completely. 
  6. Assemble your salads with the cooled farro and beets. Let the bars cool in the pan for at least 30 minutes then transfer to the fridge. 
  7. Put away your prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Kale & Sausage Burritos and White Bean Pasta for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Boil your water for the pasta. Start your mushrooms for the pasta and the sausage for the burritos in separate skillets. 
  3. Once the sausage is done, make the hashbrowns. Once the water is boiling, cook your pasta. 
  4. Cook the veggies for your burritos, then the eggs. Finish up the white bean pasta. 
  5. Put your prepped food into containers and let it cool completely. Clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Staff Picks Meal Plan
notes:

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Granola: Add dried fruit (cranberries, raisins and golden raisins would all be great). Also, leave out the nuts if you need to!

For the Pancakes: If you don't like bananas or don't have any on hand, use 1/2 cup of apple sauce or plain yogurt instead.

For the Soup: Shrimp and thinly sliced beef could work in place of chicken. Swap the tofu for lentils, edamame, white beans, or chickpeas. You can also use any noodle that you have on hand!

For the Quesadillas: Really any veggies can work in these quesadillas, so use whatever you love or have on hand! The type of cheese you use is also up to you, so pick your favorite!

For the Meatballs: You can switch up the protein here! Ground turkey, ground Italian sausage, or ground chicken would work for the omnivore version. For the veg versions, impossible meat, or your other favorite plant-based ground meat. You could also use 15 oz canned beans, drained and mashed.

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to grab GF oats for the granola! You will need gluten-free flour for the pancakes. You will need to use GF noodles as well as liquid aminos (to replace soy sauce) in the soup. Grab GF tortillas for the farmer's market quesadillas. Make sure you have GF pasta or gluten-free bread depending on which recipe you choose to make for the meatballs! You will also need GF bread crumbs for these as well.

Dairy-free swaps: Grab non-dairy yogurt to enjoy with your pumpkin spice granola! You will also need non-dairy milk for the pancakes as well as vegan chocolate chips if you are adding them! Make sure you have non-dairy cheese for the farmer's market quesadillas and for the Italian-inspired meatball recipe!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com

Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Classic Banana Pancakes and Italian-inspired Meatballs Two Ways for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

title: 30 Minute Recipes Plan

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Muffins: You can go crazy with the add-ins such as chocolate chips, chopped nuts, nut butter, coconut flakes, or chia seeds.

For the Smoothies: Add any other fruits you enjoy to this recipe! Strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, pineapple, etc!

For the Wraps: Swap the protein for shrimp, thinly sliced pork, or tempeh. If you can't find cellophane noodles you can leave them out and add more crunchy veggies!

For the Salad: Swap out the pears for apples. If you don't like quinoa, use farro or a different grain you enjoy!

For the Pasta Salad: If you want to add protein to this pasta salad, chickpeas, pinto beans, white beans, shredded chicken, or cooked chicken sausage would be great. Swap the green goddess dressing for pesto or a sauce of your choice!

Gluten-free swaps: Use an all-purpose GF flour for the muffins. Grab GF tortillas for the Vietnamese-Inspired Wraps. You will need GF pasta for the springy pasta salad. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the muffins and for the smoothies. You will need dairy-free yogurt for the smoothies as well as the pasta salad! Use your favorite crumbly cheese to replace the feta in the salads, or simply leave it out!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Frech Toast Muffins, Vietnamese-Inspired Wraps, and the Spinach Pear Salads here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat your oven to 350 F (175 C) and prepare the protein for the wraps. 
  3. Cook the quinoa for the salads and make your batter for the muffins. Get the muffins in the oven. 
  4. Bake the chickpeas if using and cook the protein and rice noodles for the wraps. Cool the muffins on a wire rack. 
  5. Make the peanut sauce for the wraps while everything cools. Once cooled, assemble the wraps and salads. 
  6. Put away your cooled and prepped food. Clean up your kitchen and then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

  2. Boil the water for the pasta. While the water boils, prep the dressing for the pasta salad. 
  3. Cook the pasta and veggies. While it cooks, prepare your smoothies. 
  4. Put away your prepped smoothie cubes or bags while the pasta salad cools. 
  5. Assemble your pasta salad into containers, put everything away, then relax!

title: Back to School Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Burritos: These burritos don't have meat and are definitely filling without them. But if you want to add meat, breakfast sausage, bacon, or ham would be delicious. Add any veggies you'd normally like in an omelet!

For the Blackberry Crumble Bars: Don't like blackberries? Use your favorite berries instead! These bars would be just as delicious with blueberries, raspberries, or strawberries. I would stick to berries for these bars and avoid other fruits as the cooking time may need to be increased. 

For the White Bean Sandwich: Instead of using bread and making this a sandwich, you could put this in a wrap, pita pocket, or lavash. Swap white beans for chickpeas, deli meat, or shredded chicken.

For the Cold Noodles: Add a different protein such a shredded chicken, shrimp, tempeh, chickpeas, or tofu! Cooking times are in the recipe notes!

Gluten-free swaps: Grab gluten-free tortillas for your breakfast burritos and for the pinwheels. Make sure to have gluten-free oats for the blackberry crumble bars. Grab GF bread for the white bean sandwiches. Use rice ramen noodles and liquid aminos or tamari in the cold noodle bowls.

For the Snack Lunches: Use whatever sides you like! Use your favorite fruits, chips, trail mix, granola...all snacks are fair game!

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy cheese in the breakfast burritos. Grab vegan butter for the crumble bars. Choose your favorite non-dairy cheese to add to the white bean sandwiches. Grab vegan mayo and vegan cheese slices for the snack lunches!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Breakfast Burritos, White Bean Sandwiches, and Cold Noodles here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Start your boiling water for the Cold Noodles and get your veggies cooking for the Breakfast Burritos. 
  3. While those cook, make your sauce for the Cold Noodles and whisk your eggs together for the Breakfast Burritos. 
  4. Finish up the Cold Noodles while you cook your eggs. 
  5. While your burrito filling cools, make your spread for the White Bean Sandwiches. For best results assemble sandwiches right before eating! 
  6. Assemble your burritos. Put away your cooled and prepped food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Blackberry Crumble Bars and Pinwheel Snack Lunches for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Preheat your oven to 350 F (175 C) and prepare the Blackberry Crumble Bars. 
  3. Get the bars in the oven and prepare your Pinwheel sandwiches and aioli. 
  4. While the bars bake, finish preparing your Pinwheel Snack Lunches. 
  5. Let the bars cool completely, put your prepped food away, clean up, then relax!

title: Minimal Cooking Meal Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Scallion Pancakes: Use whatever veggies you have on hand. Shredded cabbage, zucchini, chopped kale/greens, mushrooms, bell peppers, hot chilies. Even cooked leftover veggies will work in this recipe.

For the Overnight Oats: Feel free to add more chopped-up fruit to these oats! Other add-ins such as chia seeds, coconut flakes, chopped nuts, or crushed graham crackers would be delicious.

For the Orzo Skillet: Chicken/ veg sausage is the easiest, but you can also use chicken breast, turkey breast, any other kind of sausage, ground meat, tempeh, or chickpeas. Add in any other seasonal produce you enjoy as well!

For the Fajitas: If you aren't into bell peppers, try sliced cabbage, zucchini, carrots, or mushrooms. Swap steak and tempeh for shredded chicken, shrimp, tofu strips or portobello mushrooms. 

For the Egg Roll in a Bowl: Not feeling rice? You can use any grain or even noodles of your choice for this meal. We used a bag of coleslaw mix for this, but you can chop up your favorite fresh veggies such as cabbage, carrots, zucchini, edamame, snap peas, onion, green beans, etc!

Gluten-free swaps: Use an all-purpose GF flour for the scallion pancakes. Make sure to grab GF oats for the overnight oats. Use GF orzo or a short GF pasta for the orzo skillet. You will need GF tortillas for the fajitas, we love Mission Brand. Sub soy sauce for liquid aminos or tamari in the egg roll in a bowl.

Dairy-free swaps: Make sure you have your favorite non-dairy milk and non-dairy vanilla yogurt for the overnight oats. Use non-dairy cheese for the orzo skillet or simply leave it out!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Scallion Pancakes, Summer Orzo Skillet, and Fajitas here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Prepare your protein for the Fajitas and get it into the bag with the seasoning. 
  3. While your protein is marinating, get the protein and orzo going for the Orzo Skillet. 
  4. Keep cooking the Orzo Skillet while you heat your pan for your Fajitas. Once the pan is hot, get your Fajita veggies cooking. 
  5. Finish up the Orzo Skillet and the Fajitas. Once they are done, take them off the heat and let them cool while you make the batter for the Scallion Pancakes. 
  6. Make the Scallion Pancakes and then let them cool on a wire rack. Assemble your meals into containers and once they have cooled completely put them away. Clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Peaches and Cream ONOs and Egg Roll in a Bowl for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the waffles and for the chowder. Use non-dairy milk and dairy-free shredded cheese for the tater tot casserole.  For the lasagna, follow the instructions for the tofu ricotta and buy your favorite non-dairy cheese!
