title: Low Waste Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Breakfast Quesadillas: This meal is very filling with beans and potatoes, but if you want to add meat, bacon, ham, sausage, chorizo, or ground “meat” would all be delicious!

For the Granola: You can go crazy with the customizations here! Add more nuts, dried fruit, and chocolate (after baking)! Whatever you have in your pantry is great.

For the Curry: Feel free to use red curry paste if you don't have green! You can also add any additional veggies that you enjoy.

For the Salads: Add a crunchy carb to make this more filling! Tortilla chips, croutons, fresh bread, chickpeas, pita, etc! You can also add protein such as chicken, shrimp, tofu, tempeh, black beans, etc!

For the Pasta: If you can't find flank steak, ribeye, sirloin, skirt steak, and NY strip would all work here. Peppers and onions or classic, but if you want to add more veggies, spinach, mushrooms, summer squash, and artichokes would all work.

Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to grab gluten-free tortillas for the breakfast quesadillas. You will need GF oats for the vanilla almond granola. You will need GF flour for the buffalo cauliflower. Make sure to grab a GF pasta for the pasta skillet!

Dairy-free swaps: use your favorite non-dairy cheese for the breakfast quesadillas and the Philly cheesesteak pasta. If you are enjoying your granola with yogurt, make sure to grab your favorite non-dairy yogurt! You will also need non-dairy for the buffalo cauliflower.

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: 

talia@workweeklunch.com

Additional tips to make this plan low waste:

  • Freeze the remaining ingredients that you don't use up from the breakfast quesadillas! Tortillas, spinach, veggie broth, and shredded cheese can all be frozen and used in future meals!
  • Pretty much all of the ingredients in the Vanilla almond granola are great pantry staples! If you don't have them already, they are great additions that you will use over and over. 
  • You can use leftover spinach from the quesadillas in the curry! If you aren't going to use up the rest of the ginger, you can mince it and store it in the freezer!
  • If you don't have rice for the green curry, you can use noodles or short pasta!
  • You use ½  onion in the buffalo cauliflower salads and the Philly cheesesteak pasta! Hot sauce can also last over two years in the fridge if you have to buy a new bottle!
  • Grab a shredded cheese you would like to use in the quesadillas and the Philly cheesesteak pasta- I think provolone or mozzarella would be great.
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Refried Bean Quesadillas, Green Curry, and Buffalo Cauliflower Salads here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Prep your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat your oven to 425 F (220 C) and prepare the sauce for the cauliflower. 
  3. Bake the tots for the quesadillas and the cauliflower (the first time) together. While that bakes, make the rice for the curry. 
  4. Make the beans and veggies for the quesadillas and start cooking the protein for the curry. 
  5. Assemble the quesadillas and bake them along with the cauliflower for the second time. While that bakes, continue cooking the curry. 
  6. Let everything cool and assemble the food in containers. Once completely cooled, put your food away, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Vanilla Almond Granola and Philly Cheesesteak Pasta for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe! Preheat your oven to 325 F (160 C). 
  2. Mix up your granola and get it in the oven. While that bakes, make the marinade for the Philly Cheesesteak Pasta. 
  3. Make your pasta for the Philly Cheesesteak Pasta and check on the granola while it continues to bake. 
  4. Let the granola cool completely while you finish up the pasta. 
  5. Once the pasta has cooled too, assemble it into containers and put everything away. Clean up and then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Seasonal Summer Meal Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Muffins: You can use fresh or frozen blueberries for these! Top with a bit of coarse sugar to make them even more delicious!

For the Fritters: Feel free to add other veggies into this! Grated sweet potato, carrots, onion, zucchini, etc! And go crazy with the toppings, such as eggs, avocado, sour cream, sriracha, or ketchup.

For the Antipasto Salad: Use your favorite store-bought Italian dressing instead of making your own. If you don’t like certain ingredients such as olives or artichokes, simply leave them out!

For the Greek Salad Wraps: Make it even more filling with cooked quinoa, farro, couscous, or rice. Swap the wrap for pita and add in any other veggies you love!

For the Teriyaki Meatballs: Use ground beef, pork, or chicken instead of turkey. And use white beans instead of chickpeas in the veg version! Although broccoli is in season, you can swap it out for any other veggie you like!

Gluten-free swaps: Use a GF all purpose flour for the muffins and the fritters. Make sure to use GF orzo in the antipasto salad.Grab GF wraps for the greek salad wraps. Make sure to use tamari or liquid aminos instead of soy sauce for the meatballs.

Dairy-free swaps: Make sure to grab non-dairy yogurt for the muffins and the greek salad wraps! Use dairy-free cheese in the summer squash fritters, antipasto salad, and greek salad wraps.

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com

Here are the other fruits and veggies that are in season right now!

  • cherries
  • peaches
  • melon
  • blueberries
  • raspberries
  • tomatoes
  • strawberries
  • artichokes
  • broccoli
  • peppers
  • peas
  • cucumber
  • potato
  • zucchini and summer squash
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Blueberry Muffins, Antipasto Orzo Salad, and Greek Wraps, here's how to get it done fast:

  2. Preheat the oven for the Blueberry Muffins. Prepare your orzo for the Antipasto salad if using. 
  3. Make the muffin batter and get them in the oven. Prepare your protein for the Greek Wraps. 
  4. Once the orzo has cooled, assemble your Antipasto salads and put them away. 
  5. Once your protein for the wraps has cooled, assemble your Greek Wraps and put them away. 
  6. Put away the muffins, any other food, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

  2. Mix together your meatballs, then start your rice or noodles for the side. 
  3. Cook your veggies and then start your meatballs for the Teriyaki meal. 
  4. While the Teriyaki Meatballs finish cooking, start your Fritters.

title: Budget-Friendly Plan
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

For the Banana Pancakes: If you hate bananas or don’t have any, you can use applesauce or plain yogurt instead (measurements in recipe). And go crazy with your favorite add-ins!

For the Baklava ONOs: If you don’t want to buy almonds, you can use any nuts you have laying around, or substitute nuts completely for fruit! It will make it less traditional, but still delicious.

For the Thai Basil Stir Fry: Grab regular basil instead of Thai basil, it is in season right now! This stir fry works with pretty much any protein, so use your favorite if you don’t like chicken or tofu!

For the Tuna/Chickpea Sandwiches: Instead of buying a loaf of bread, you can put this filling in a pita, wrap, or lavash! You can swap the celery for cucumbers and use any leafy greens you enjoy.

For the Fiesta Rice and Beans: Feel free to forgo the sausage links if you want to make this even more affordable. Use any veggies you have laying around or in your freezer, think color!

Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free flour for the banana pancakes. Make sure your oats are GF for the baklava onos. Use liquid aminos or tamari instead of soy sauce in the stir fry. Make sure to grab GF bread for the Tuna/Chickpea sandwiches. 

Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk and vegan chocolate chips for the banana pancakes. You will also need non-dairy milk for the baklava onos. Use vegan mayo in the tuna/chickpea sandwiches. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com

Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk and vegan chocolate chips for the muffins. Grab your favorite non-dairy cheese for the burgers. Use non-dairy yogurt or non-dairy milk for the stroganoff.

notes:

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Cajun Waffles: Finely minced celery, red bell pepper, jalapeno, and okra would taste great in this recipe! Adding cheese or chopped-up bacon/ham would also be delicious!
  • For the Summer Granola: This recipe is extremely customizable! Swap out dried apricots and cherries for dried peaches, mango, pineapple, figs, dried cranberries, blueberries, strawberries, dates, or raisins!
  • For the Mac and Cheese: Add more veggies such as cauliflower, broccoli, asparagus, zucchini, green beans, different color bell peppers, etc! Shredded chicken would also be great in this.
  • For the One-Pot Burritos: If you don't like salsa verde, use your favorite type of salsa! You can swap the protein for ground meat, beef strips, your favorite plant-based “meat”, or just more vegetables!
  • For the Lettuce Cups: There is a lot of customization here as well! Swap the ground chicken for turkey or beef. Add broccoli, cauliflower, and bell peppers to these as well as long as they are shredded or chopped finely. If you're not a fan of mango salsa, pineapple, peaches, or even green apple would all work too.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free flour for the cajun waffles. Use gluten-free oats for the granola. Make sure to grab gluten-free pasta for the mac and cheese! You will also need GF tortillas for the one-pot burritos. 
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk for the cajun waffles and the mac and cheese. Grab your favorite non-dairy yogurt to enjoy with the granola. You will need non-dairy shredded cheese for the one-pot burritos. 

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Cajun Waffles, Mac and Cheese and One-Pot Burritos here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Chop your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat the oven if you plan on baking the mac and cheese and start boiling water for the pasta. 
  3. While the water boils, prepare the filling for the One-Pot Burritos. 
  4. Set the burrito filling aside to cool and prepare the mac and cheese. 
  5. Finish up the Mac and Cheese and make your waffle batter. Assemble the burritos with the cooled filling and put them away. 
  6. Put the Mac away into containers and let it finish cooling while you make the waffles. Let them cool completely on a wire rack before putting them away. 
  7. Finish putting the prepped and cooled food away, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Summer Granola and Thai Lettuce Cups for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Preheat the oven for the granola and start your filling for the lettuce cups. 
  3. Get your granola in the oven and continue to check on it while you finish up the lettuce cup filling and salsa. 
  4. Once the granola is done, add the dried fruit and let it cool while you finish assembling your lettuce cups in their containers and let the filling cool completely before putting it away. 
  5. Put your cooled food away, clean up, then relax! 

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: June 30th Meal Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Peach Smoothies: Feel free to add in other fruits and veggies you have! Spinach, blueberries, avocado, mangoes, raspberries, etc.
  • For the Granola Bars: If you don't like dates, you can use figs instead (see recipe notes for instructions!) Add your favorite toppings such as dried fruit, chocolate chips, and/or nuts!
  • For the Tacos: Switch up the protein by using shredded chicken, shrimp, beef, or chickpeas.
  • For the Buffet Prep: You can really mix and match with this prep! Pick and choose which elements you want to make.)
  • For the Lasagna Skillet: Add more veggies by including eggplant, mushroom, zucchini, artichoke, cauliflower, broccoli, etc.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free oats for the no-bake granola bars. Grab gluten-free tortillas for the tacos. Use gluten-free all-purpose flour in the corn fritters for the BBQ buffet prep. Make sure to get GF lasagna noodles for the lasagna skillet.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your go-to dairy-free milk and yogurt for the smoothies. You will need vegan mayo and non-dairy cheese for the tacos. Use the tofu ricotta recipe included for the lasagna skillet, and make sure to grab non-dairy shredded cheese and parmesan cheese for topping!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Summer Peach Smoothies, Jackfruit/Pork Tacos, and the BBQ Buffet Prep here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Get your kitchen clean and ready! Chop your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Preheat your oven to the correct temp for your BBQ Buffet Prep and start cooking your protein for the tacos.
  3. Get your protein and green beans in the oven while you cook your corn and corn fritters and finish up the protein for the tacos.
  4. Finish up the elements for the BBQ Buffet Prep while the taco protein and corn cool.
  5. Make the smoothie cubes while the buffet prep cools and put away the taco components.
  6. Assemble any meals as desired, put away your prepped food, clean, then relax!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

No-Bake Date Granola Bars and the Lasagna Skillet for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Start the Lasagna Skillet by cooking the pasta.
  3. While the protein for the lasagna cooks, start the granola bars.
  4. Finish up the Lasagna Skillet and assemble it into containers and allow it to cool completely.
  5. Finish up the bars while the skillet cools, clean up, put everything away, then relax!

title: Minimal Chopping Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Doughnuts: If you don't have a doughnut pan, you can easily make these into muffins! Lemon extract is also optional.
  • For the Overnight Oats: If you don't like raisins, you can use craisins, golden raisins, other dried fruit, and/or chocolate chips instead.
  • For the Noodle Salad: If you aren't into salmon or edamame, chicken, shrimp, tofu, tempeh, mushroom, or chickpeas would all work here! You can also choose your favorite noodles for the salad.
  • For the BLATs: You can add hummus, sliced cheese, or more mayo if you don't love avocado. Sub the bacon/ tempeh bacon for any deli meat or protein of your choosing.
  • For the Chickpea Pasta: This meal is extremely customizable! Add any veggies you have leftover, and swap out the chickpeas for a protein of your choice. Chicken or shrimp would be great.
  • Gluten-free swaps: You will need a GF all-purpose flour for the doughnuts. Make sure to use gluten-free oats in the ONOs. Use gluten-free pasta for the noodle salad and for the chickpea pasta. Make sure to grab gluten-free bread for the BLATs!
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the doughnuts and the overnight oats. Make sure to use vegan pesto and nutritional yeast instead of pesto and parmesan cheese in the chickpea pasta!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making Lemon Poppyseed Doughnuts, Broccoli Slaw Noodle Salad, and BLTs with Avocado here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Chop your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. First, get the doughnut batter ready and pop your doughnuts in the oven.
  3. While they bake, prep are the Broccoli Slaw Noodle Salad.
  4. While that cools (the protein has to cool), prep ingredients for BLAT sandwiches.
  5. Store all the meals in the fridge, clean and enjoy the rest of your day!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Cinnamon Oatmeal Cookie Onos and Chickpea Pesto Pasta for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. First, cook the pasta for the pesto pasta salad.
  3. Meanwhile, make the cinnamon oatmeal cookie overnight oats.
  4. Finish the pesto pasta salads
  5. Store everything in the fridge and enjoy the rest of your night!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Stovetop Only Plan
notes:
This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the breakfast burritos: Any veggies you have around your kitchen will work in these! If you're not a fan of chorizo/soyrizo, you can use sausage, bacon, ham, "meat" crumbles, or beans!
  • For the Fritters: These are great eaten with toppings! Applesauce, greek yogurt, sour cream, hot sauce, or ketchup would all be delicious.
  • For the Sweet Potato Mash Bowls: You can use regular potato here if you don't like sweet potato. You can definitely add meat to this if you'd like- shredded chicken, ground beef/turkey, steak, or "meat" crumbles would all work.
  • For the Lo Mein: Use pork, beef strips, shrimp, tempeh, or extra veggies if you don't want to use chicken or tofu.
  • For the Salmon and Orzo: You can use tilapia, halibut, shrimp, or chicken here! You can also add spinach or kale, cooked eggplant, red onion, mushrooms, or other veggies you like.
  • Gluten-free swaps:  Use gluten-free tortillas for the breakfast burritos. You'll need an all-purpose gluten-free flour for the fritters. Use tamari or liquid aminos instead of soy sauce for the lo mein. Use gluten-free orzo or a short pasta for the salmon and orzo salad.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy cheese in the breakfast burritos and in the sweet potato mash bowls. Skip the feta or add your favorite non-dairy cheese crumbles in the salmon and orzo!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making Soyrizo/Chorizo Breakfast Burritos, Sweet Potato Mash Bowls, and Lo Mein here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Get your kitchen clean and ready! Chop your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized. Prepare the sweet potato by your preferred method and set it aside to cool.
  2. Start cooking your potato mixture for the Breakfast Burritos. While that cooks, prepare the sauce for the Lo Mein and set aside.
  3. Finish up the different components for the Breakfast Burritos and set aside to cool.
  4. In one of the skillets you used for the Breakfast Burritos, prepare the bean mixture for the Sweet Potato Mash Bowls. While that cooks, prepare the noodles for the Lo Mein.
  5. While the beans and veggies cool, finish up the Lo Mein.
  6. Assemble the Sweet Potato Mash Bowls while the Lo Mein cools. Once the components are completely cool, assemble the Breakfast Burritos.
  7. Put away your cooled food in containers, clean up, and relax!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Breakfast Fritters and Salmon/Chickpeas With Orzo Salad for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Grate your carrot and potato for the Fritters and set aside in a colander or on paper towels to drain.
  3. Prepare the salmon or chickpeas for the Orzo Salad and cook the orzo.
  4. While the protein and orzo cools, make the fritters and let them cool on a wire rack.
  5. Assemble your Salmon/Chickpea Orzo Salads and put them away. Once your fritters are cooled completely, put those away. Clean up and relax!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Colorful Meal Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Funfetti Pancakes: Use your favorite sprinkles and feel free to use your favorite add-ins as well!
  • For the Cherry Smoothies: Toss in any other fruits you enjoy! You can also add peanut butter, protein powder, spinach, chia seeds, etc.
  • For the Burrito Bowls: Corn, zucchini, red onions, poblanos, mushrooms, sweet potatoes, etc would all work in place of bell peppers! Swap chicken/beans for beef, steak, ground turkey, "meat" crumbles, tofu, seitan, or mushrooms!
  • For the Chopped Salads: Add your favorite protein to make this meal even more filling. This salad is completely customizable, so add in all your favorites- think color!
  • For the Thai Noodle Bowls: Swap chicken/edamame for shrimp, beef strips, pork, tofu, or seitan. Use your favorite type of noodle or what you already have!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free flour for the funfetti pancakes. Use tamari instead of soy sauce for the dressing in the Chopped Salads and in the Thai Noodle Bowls.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the funfetti pancakes, cherry smoothies, and the rice in the green rice burrito bowls. Also, grab non-dairy milk for the smoothies.
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making Funfetti Pancakes, Green Rice Burrito Bowls, and Rainbow Chopped Salads here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Get your kitchen clean and ready! Preheat your oven to 400 F (200 C), chop your ingredients, and separate them by each recipe to stay organized.
  2. Prepare your Green Rice Burrito Bowls.
  3. While your rice and veggies are cooking for the burrito bowls, assemble your Rainbow Chopped Salads.
  4. Finish up the burrito bowls and assemble them in containers.
  5. Make the Funfetti Pancakes.
  6. While the pancakes cool on a wire rack, put away your burrito bowls and salads. Once cooled, put away the pancakes, finish cleaning up, then relax!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Cherry Berry Smoothies and Rainbow Thai Noodle Bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Prepare your ingredients for each recipe!
  2. Get started on your Rainbow Thai Noodle Bowls.
  3. While you are finishing up your noodle bowls, make your Cherry Berry Smoothies. Put them away in the freezer.
  4. Once your noodle bowls are cooled, put the food away in containers, clean up, then relax!

title: Freezer-Friendly Meal Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Breakfast Sandwiches: Add any veggies you like! Think about what you enjoy in an omelet and go from there. If you want to aff a protein, bacon, ham, or sausage would be delicious.
  • For the Oatmeal Bake: If you don't like apples, use pears or bananas instead!
  • For the Ravioli Lasagna: Swap the ground sausage for ground beef or used meat-filled ravioli! You can also add more chopped veggies.
  • For the Burritos: These are super customizable! Add in any of your favorite veggies and feel free to change the protein. Ground beef, sausage, chorizo, and ground "meat" would all work.
  • For the Soup: Add shredded chicken or jackfruit for more protein if you want! This is also a great soup for leftover veggies, really anything will work!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Grab gluten-free English muffins for your breakfast sandwiches. Use gluten-free oats for the apple oatmeal bake. Use gluten-free ravioli or pasta shells in the ravioli bake. Use gluten-free tortillas in the burritos.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk in the breakfast sandwiches and in the oatmeal bake. Use non-dairy shredded cheese and follow the instructions to make tofu ricotta! Use dairy-free cheese in the burritos as well!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com

tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making Breakfast Sandwiches, Ravioli Lasagna, and Burritos here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Get your kitchen clean and ready! Preheat your oven to 375 F (190 C). Defrost your proteins as needed, chop your ingredients, and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Get your protein and rice cooking for the Burritos.
  3. Bake your veggies for the Lasagna while you prep the rest of your ingredients for the Burritos.
  4. Set your burrito ingredients aside to cool while you prepare your Lasagna and then get it in the oven.
  5. While that bakes, prepare your ingredients for the Breakfast Sandwiches. When the Lasagna is close to done, bump up the oven temp to 400 F (200 C) and bake your egg mixture for the Breakfast Sandwiches.
  6. When your burrito ingredients are completely cooled, assemble your burritos. When the lasagna has cooled you can put it away whole or into meal prep containers.
  7. Clean up while your egg bake cools, then assemble the Breakfast Sandwiches and put them away. Finish cleaning up and relax!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Apple Oatmeal Bake and Black Bean Soup for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350 F (175 C) and prepare your ingredients for each recipe.
  2. Prepare your mixture for the Apple Oatmeal Bake and get it in the oven.
  3. While that bakes, make the Black Bean Soup.
  4. Clean up while both meals cool completely, then put everything away. Finish cleaning up, then relax!

Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG!

title: Seasonal Meal Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Waffles: Add some heat to these with cayenne or chopped jalapeno. You can also add more shredded veggies such as green onion, shredded zucchini, or a protein like bacon or chopped ham!
  • For the Smoothies: Add spinach, avocado, but butter, chia seeds, oats, or flax seeds if you'd like!
  • For the Veggie Grain Bowls: If you don't like barley, use farro or quinoa. Eggplant, broccolini, and portobello mushrooms would also be great in this.
  • For the Spanakopita Orzo: If you're not into lentils, swap them for chickpeas, white beans, peas, shredded chicken, or ground turkey.
  • For the Sweet Potato Burgers: If you're not a fan of salmon burgers, swap the salmon for chicken, turkey, beef, or pork. For the vegetarian version, swap the chickpeas for white beans, pinto beans, or black beans.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use all-purpose, gluten-free flour for the savory waffles. Make sure to swap barley for quinoa and soy sauce for tamari in the veggie grain bowls! Use gluten-free orzo in the Spanakopita Skillet. Grab gluten-free bread crumbs for the Sweet Potato Burgers.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk in the savory waffles and the berry smoothies. Also, grab non-dairy yogurt for the smoothies and for the dressing in the veggie grain bowls. Use your favorite non-dairy feta or crumbly cheese in the Spanakopita Orzo.

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com

  • Chard

  • Rhubarb

Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making Savory Cheddar and Spinach Waffles, Veggie Grain Bowls, and Spanakopita Orzo & Lentils here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Get your kitchen clean and ready! Chop your ingredients and separate them by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Start your barley or grain of choice for the Veggie Grain Bowls.
  3. While your grains are cooking, start your Spanakopita Orzo & Lentils.
  4. Once your Spanakopita Orzo & Lentils is done cooking, grill your veggies. If you are grilling indoors on a pan you can do this at the same time!
  5. Assemble your Veggie Grain Bowls and Spanakopita Orzo & Lentils into containers and allow them to cool. While they cool, make your waffles.
  6. Once everything has cooled, put your food away, clean up, then relax!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Very Berry Smoothies and Sweet Potato Burger With Roasted Veggies for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  2. Make your Sweet Potato Burgers with Roasted Veggies.
  3. While the burgers cool, prepare your Very Berry Smoothies.

title: One-Pot Meal Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Blueberry Crisp: If you want to use other berries that aren't blueberries, go for it! You can also leave out or switch up the nuts!
  • For the Lemon Blueberry Bread: If you want to add a glaze on top of this bread that would be delicious! The instructions are in the notes of the recipe!
  • For the Pasta Primavera: Feel free to use up any other leftover veggies or herbs you have here!
  • For the Fajitas: Swap out the steak for shredded chicken, grilled chicken, or shrimp. Swap the tempeh for portobello mushrooms or sliced tofu. You can also make your own tacos seasoning instead of buying it (instructions in recipe notes)!
  • For the Jambalaya: You can easily add in other proteins here, such as chicken breast or beans. Make sure you adjust the spiciness to your liking!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Make sure you use gluten-free oats in the blueberry crisp! Use all-purpose gluten-free flour for the lemon blueberry bread and in the Jambalaya. Use gluten-free pasta in the pasta primavera. Make sure to grab gluten-free tortillas for the fajitas.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Grab your favorite non-dairy yogurt to enjoy with the blueberry crisp. Use non-dairy milk in the lemon blueberry bread. Use your favorite non-dairy cheese in the pasta primavera.
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Lemon Blueberry Bread, Pasta Primavera, and Fajitas here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Get your kitchen clean and ready! Preheat your oven to 350F (175C) and marinate the protein for your fajitas. Chop and separate your ingredients by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Get the Lemon Blueberry Bread in the oven and start the Pasta Primavera while that bakes.
  3. When the pasta is just about done, make the fajitas.
  4. Take the bread out of the oven and let the pasta and fajitas cool completely before separating into containers.
  5. Once everything is cooled, put the food away, clean, then relax!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Chocolate Cinnamon Granola and Jambalaya-Inspired Rice Skillet for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Preheat your oven to 325F (160C) and get your ingredients separated by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Get the granola in the oven and start the rice.
  3. Stir the granola halfway while you are finishing up the rice skillet.
  4. When both the granola and rice skillet are finish, let them cool completely before putting into containers.
  5. Clean up your kitchen, then relax!

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Horchata Oats: Berries or bananas would be great to add to these! You can swap out vanilla yogurt for plain if you'd like.
  • For the Muffins: Use any trail mix you enjoy here, just make sure it is unsalted! Swap out applesauce for mashed banana if you prefer it.
  • For the Sandwiches: Feel free to add shredded chicken, turkey, or even deli meat to add more protein to these.
  • For the Pasta Salad: Add in any other veggies that you would enjoy or need to use up! You can also make your own hummus instead of using storebought.
  • For the Poke Bowls: Instead of noodles, you can use rice or put this over a bed of leafy greens. You could also swap the protein for chicken, shrimp, seitan, or even pulled pork.

  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk and yogurt for the overnight oats. You'll also need dairy-free milk for the muffins. Use tofu ricotta in the sheet pan sandwiches.

Trail Mix Muffins and Teriyaki Poke Bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Preheat your oven to 375F (190C), get your chopping done, and separate your ingredients by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Get your protein marinating and make the quick pickled veggies for the Teriyaki Poke Bowls.
  3. Prepare the batter and bake your Trail Mix Muffins.
  4. Cook the noodles and protein for the bowls while your muffins bake.
  5. Once the muffins are done, allow them to cool while you assemble the bowls.
  6. Let everything finish cooling, clean up your kitchen, and relax!

title: New Recipes Meal Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Scones: If you can't find sun-dried tomatoes and want to try making your own, you can follow this recipe!
  • For the Waffles: You can use buttermilk in these instead of regular for a more traditional texture! Fresh fruit would be delicious on top.
  • For the Vermicelli Bowls: Swap out the pork for chicken or shrimp and the tofu for temphe, seitan, or edamame.
  • For the Quesadillas: Feel free to add any additional veggies you have laying around here! Bell peppers, onions, asparagus, jalapenos, etc would all work!
  • For the Burger Bowls: Use frozen fries, tater tots, or hash browns instead of making them from scratch. Go crazy with the toppings and use whatever you would like on a burger!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free flour for the scones and the waffles! Use tamari or liquid aminos instead of soy sauce in the vermicelli bowls. Make sure to grab gluten-free tortillas for the quesadillas.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk and melted vegan butter for the scones (exact measurements in the recipe!) Use non-dairy milk for the waffles as well. Use non-dairy cream cheese and non-dariy shredded cheese for the quesadillas! Grab your favorite non-dairy shredded cheese for the burger bowls!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com

tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Sundried Tomato and Basil Scones, Vermicelli Bowls, and Spinach and Artichoke Quesadillas, here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Get your kitchen clean and ready! Freeze your butter while you clean and defrost any proteins as needed.
  2. Preheat your oven to 400F (200C). Make the marinade for the Vermicelli Bowls and get your protein marinating while you prepare the veggies for your recipes. Separate the ingredients by recipe to stay organized.
  3. Make the pickles for the Vermicelli Bowls and then mix together the scone batter. Shape the scones and get them in the freezer.
  4. Get your protein for the bowls in the oven, then prepare your quesadilla filling. Assemble and get those in the oven at the same time.
  5. Make the dipping sauce and cook the noodles for the bowls. Once the protein and quesadillas are done, get the scones in the oven.
  6. Once everything is cooked, clean up your kitchen while your food cools. Assemble into containers, put away, and relax!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Coconut Caramel Chocolate Chip Waffles and Shake Shack Burger Bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Preheat your oven to 350F (175C) and get your chopping done. Separate your ingredients by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Toast your coconut flakes while your potatoes are soaking. Once they are done toasting, bump the oven up to 400F (200C).
  3. Get the fries in the oven and prepare the Burger Bowl elements.
  4. Once the Burger Bowls are done, remove from the heat and allow to cool while you prepare the waffles.
  5. Let your waffles cool on a wire rack to avoid sogginess. Once they are done, put away your food, clean up, and relax!

title: Low Waste Meal Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Banana Granola: If you don't have walnuts, use whatever nuts or seeds you already have! Feel free to add chocolate chips, dried fruit, coconut flakes, etc.
  • For the Zucchini Fritters: You can try to add other shredded veggies to this recipe such as sweet potato, carrot, potato, onion, etc! Make sure to squeeze the water out.
  • For the Teriyaki Salmon/Tofu: You can swap these proteins for tempeh, chicken, beef, shrimp, or cooked edamame.
  • For the Spiced Lentils: Customization is pretty endless here! Add in your favorite veggies and feel free to add chicken, pork, shrimp, or even tofu.
  • For the Hummus Wraps: We used chicken sausage here but you can use your favorite type! Add in any other veggies that you have laying around.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free flour for the fritters if needed. Use liquid aminos or tamari instead of soy sauce in the teriyaki salmon/tofu. Use gluten-free tortillas for the sausage kale wraps!
  • Dairy-free swaps: Grab non-dairy yogurt to eat

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com

Ways to use up or store these ingredients

Walnuts: You only need one cup of walnuts for the Banana Granola, but they have a shelf life of three months in the cabinet or a year in the freezer! If you don't want to purchase walnuts, use any nuts or seeds you already have.

Scallions: These are needed for the Zucchini Fritters, but you can also use them as a garnish in the Teriyaki Salmon/ Tofu. They last in the fridge for about 2 weeks, and you can also regrow them by cutting off the bulbs at the end and submerging them in water.

Ginger: Ginger is used in both the Teriyaki Salmon/Tofu and the Spiced Red Lentils. Since you will have some leftover, you can freeze this as well!

Cilantro: This is optional as a garnish in the Spiced Lentils, but if you don't feel as if you can use up a whole bunch, skip it! You can freeze cilantro as well.

Kale: Divide the kale between the Hummus wraps and the Spiced Red Lentils!

Hummus: You need hummus for the Hummus wraps, which you can either buy or make! Use the rest for snacks or in another one of our meals such as the new Hummus Pasta Salad!

And check out this post about how to keep your produce fresh!
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Banana Granola, Teriyaki Salmon/Tofu, and Spiced Red Lentils here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Get your kitchen clean and ready! Defrost any proteins as needed.
  2. Preheat the oven for the granola and get your chopping done. Separate your ingredients by recipe to stay organized.
  3. Get your granola in the oven and prepare your marinade for the Teriyaki Salmon/Tofu. While that marinates, start your rice for both the Spiced Lentils and the Teriyaki Salmon/Tofu.
  4. Once the granola is out of the oven, increase the temperature for the Teriyaki Salmon/Tofu. get your salmon/tofu in and prepare the broccoli to go in at the same time or afterwards on the same pan.
  5. While that bakes, work on the Spiced lentils on the stove.
  6. Allow everything to cool completely before storing in containers and in the fridge. Clean up while the food cools and then relax!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Zucchini Fritters and Hummus Wraps for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Preheat the oven and get your chopping done. Separate the ingredients by recipe to stay organized.
  2. Prepare the zucchini and then get the sweet potato in the oven.
  3. Cook the kale and sausage for the Hummus Wraps.
  4. While the Hummus Wrap ingredients cool, make the fritters.
  5. Allow the fritters to cool while you finish up the hummus wraps.
  6. Pack up your cooled meals, clean up, then relax!

notes:
This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Scones: If lemon blueberry isn't your favorite combination, try orange cranberry, chocolate cherry, cinnamon raisin, or raspberry almond! Measurements can be found in the post.
  • For the Brunchwrap Supreme: Really any veggies can work here, so use the ones you love! You can also add a protein like bacon, sausage, veggie "meat" crumbles, or beans!
  • For the Kale Salad: If you don't want to make your own corn salsa or blackend seasoning, feel free to buy them instead! 
  • For the Sweet & Sour Bowls: If you don't want to use chicken or cauliflower, use shrimp, beef, salmon, tempeh, tofu, or edamame!
  • For the Calzones: You can use store bought pizza dough if you don't want to make your own! There are endless filling ideas here, think of what you like on a pizza!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use an all-purpose GF flour blend for the scones and for the calzone dough! Make sure to grab gluten-free tortillas for the Brunchwrap Supreme. Sub the soy sauce for liquid aminos in the Sweet & Sour Bowls. 
  • Dairy-free swaps: For the scones, you will need to use a heavy cream substitute of non-dairy milk and melted vegan butter! Exact measurements are in the recipe. Use your favorite non-dairy shredded cheese for the Brunchwrap Supreme and the Calzones.

tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Lemon Blueberry Scones, the Kale Salad, and the Sweet and Sour Bowls here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  Get your kitchen ready and clean! Defrost any proteins as needed.
  2. Grate or chop your cold butter and freeze it while you get all your chopping done. Separate your ingredients by recipe to stay organized.
  3. Get the rice going for the Sweet and Sour bowls and cook the quinoa for the Kale Salads.
  4. Prepare dressing for the salad and sauce for the bowls. Make the scones, shape them, then get them in the freezer.
  5. Preheat your oven for the scones and get the tempeh/chicken going for the salads, then marinate the kale.
  6. Get the scones in the oven and finish up the protein for the salad. Make the corn salsa and start the protein for the Sweet and Sour bowls.
  7. While the scones bake, finish up the Sweet and Sour bowls by preparing the protein and veggies. This will come together quickly!
  8. Allow everything to cool before putting the food away, then clean up your kitchen and celebrate!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Brunchwrap Supremes and Calzones for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1.  If making your own dough, start that first to allow time for it to rest.
  2. Preheat your oven and prepare the egg or tofu mixture and get that in the oven first as it takes a while for it to bake.
  3. Make your calzone filling! When that's close to being done cut and shape your dough to prepare them to be filled.
  4. Get your calzones in the oven
  5. When the egg/tofu mixture has cooled, wrap in the tortillas and finish up the Brunchwraps.
  6. Clean up while both meals cool, then relax and enjoy your hard work!

title: Budget-Friendly Meal Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.

  • For the Zucchini Muffins: Feel free to any type of nut, seeds, chocolate chips, or dried cranberries/ raisins into these!
  • For the Breakfast Burrito Bowls: There are endless ways to customize these bowls! Add your favorite veggies, swap rice for quinoa, farro, or even potatoes, and add any toppings you normally enjoy on your burritos.
  • For the Curried Chickpea Wraps: You can add leafy greens such as spinach, kale, or swiss chard if you want! Swap the chickpeas for shredded chicken or turkey!
  • For the Pineapple Fried Rice: Shrimp, beef, edamame, and tempeh would all be delicious in this! And it is a great meal to use up any leftover veggies!
  • For the Lentil Tomato Soup: If you don't like lentils, swap them out for quinoa or rice! If you want a little heat, use fire-roasted tomatoes.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free flour if needed for the zucchini muffins. Grab gluten-free tortillas for the curried chickpea wraps! Use liquid aminos or tamari instead of soy sauce in the fried rice. Pick up some gluten-free bread to enjoy with your tomato soup!
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk in the muffins. If you choose to add cheese to your burrito bowl, make sure it is dairy-free or simply omit it!

If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com

The Cost Breakdown of these Recipes:

These price breakdowns are just estimates! They will change based on where you are located and what you already have in your pantry! Odds are, your costs will be less than these!

Zucchini Muffins: $13 for 12 muffins

Breakfast Burrito Bowls: $8.40 or $2.80/ serving

Curried Chickpea Sheet Pan Wraps: $11 or $2.75/serving

Pineapple Fried Rice: $15 or $4.60/serving

Hearty Lentil Tomato Soup: $8 or $2/serving

Total: $55.40 for about 20 meals! Not bad at all. Using what's in season and making choices based on what you have will get this down even more!
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Zucchini Muffins, Curried Chickpea Wraps, and Pineapple Fried Rice here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get your kitchen ready and clean! Defrost proteins as needed.
  2. Fire up the oven and chop everything you need for the wraps.
  3. Get your wrap ingredients in the oven first
  4. Then while the wrap ingredients cook and then cool, make the Pineapple Fried Rice
  5. While the fried rice is cooling, make the zucchini muffin batter and get them in the oven
  6. While the muffins bake, assemble the wraps and fried rice.
  7. Clean the kitchen, relax and celebrate!

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day!

Breakfast Burrito Bowls and Lentil Tomato Soup for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

  1. Get the soup going first!
  2. While the soup cooks, make the breakfast burrito bowls.
  3. Clean up and enjoy!

title: WWL Team Picks Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Breakfast Cookies: If you don't like bananas, you can replace them with applesauce or yogurt! Use your favorite add-ins here!
  • For the Okonomiyaki: You can use green cabbage instead of Napa. You can also add shredded carrots! Go crazy with the toppings here.
  • For the Salmon/Tempeh With Coconut Rice: You can substitute salmon for shrimp, chicken, steak, pork, or seitan! Omit the spice in the salsa if you don't like heat.
  • For the Italian Gnocchi Soup: You can use any short pasta, or potatoes to replace the gnocchi! If you don't want sausage, use shredded chicken, lentils, or white beans.
  • For the Black Bean Quesadillas: Add other veggies such as cauliflower, zucchini, bell peppers, red onion, corn, mushrooms, and greens. Add meat if you want as well!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use GF oats for the breakfast cookies. Use gluten-free flour for the okonomiyaki. Use GF gnocchi/pasta for the soup. Use GF tortillas for the black bean quesadillas.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use unsweetened non-dairy milk for the Gnocchi Soup! Use your favorite dairy-free cheese for the black bean quesadillas!
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com

How the Team Customizes their Favorite Recipes:

Breakfast Cookies: For these, I normally add 1/2 cup chocolate chips and 1/4 cup of chopped pecans or almonds! -Alyssa

Okonomiyaki:

I follow the recipe exactly for this one -Morgan

For the vegan version, I added some crumbled tofu and a little splash of soy sauce to the batter for extra texture! My favorite toppings are the sauces, lots of furikake, avocado, and crispy onions. - Jessica

Salmon With Spicy Mango Salsa and Coconut Rice: For the spicy salsa, I normally swap out the cucumber for avocado and add chopped red onion (about 1/4 cup or so)! Also, I add a dash of cayenne on top of the chipotle powder because I love spice. -Alyssa

Italian Gnocchi Soup: No changes for this one either! -Morgan

Sweet Potato Black Bean Quesadillas: My favorite swap for these quesadillas is using jalapeno instead of green bell pepper for a kick. And I always add chopped avocado on top! - Talia
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Breakfast Cookies, Salmon/Tempeh and Coconut Rice, and Italian Gnocchi Soup, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen ready to go and clean. Defrost proteins as needed while you get set up.
  2. Chop everything you need for the Salmon/Tempeh meal and Soup recipe
  3. Get the rice going for the Salmon/Tempeh meal, then start working on the Soup.
  4. While the Soup simmers, make the salsa and protein for your Salmon/Tempeh meal. It comes together fast!
  5. Assemble the Soup and Salmon/Tempeh meal, then work on your Breakfast Cookies.
  6. While they're baking in the oven, clean up!
  7. Celebrate and RELAX!
Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day! Okonomiyaki and Black Bean Quesadillas for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Start with the sweet potatoes for the Quesadillas since they need time to cook.
  2. Meanwhile, prepare the rest of the ingredients for the Okonomiyaki and Quesadillas.
  3. While the Quesadillas bake in the oven, make the Okonomiyaki pancakes.
  4. Let everything cool while you clean.
  5. Relax and enjoy!

title: WWL Seasonal Early Spring Plan
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Banoffee Cups: You can use milk if you don't want to add coffee to these. If vegan- adding peanut butter would be delicious! (Note that we did not test this)
  • For the Overnight Oats: You can add Greek yogurt to these to make it more filling. And as always, feel free to go nuts with the toppings!
  • For the Spinach Artichoke Pasta: Instead of cream cheese, you can use a mix of sour cream and cream cheese, or whole milk and butter! Feel free to add more veggies in as well!
  • For the Lettuce Cups: If you want this to be more filling- feel free to add rice or quinoa to the mixture- or just enjoy it on the side!
  • For the Niçoise Salad: You can add a grain to this meal to make it more filling as well! Quinoa, farro, or barley would be great. Add any other roasted veggies you love!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use gluten-free oats for both the banoffee cups and the overnight oats. Use a GF pasta for the Spinach and Artichoke Pasta. Use liquid aminos instead of soy sauce for the lettuce cups.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk in your overnight oats. Use non-dairy milk, non-dairy cream cheese, and your favorite dairy-free cheese for the pasta!
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com

What seasonal veggies are we using in this plan?

Pineapple: In the Tropical Overnight Oats! Artichoke: In the Spinach and Artichoke Pasta! You can also add roasted artichokes to the Salad Niçoise. Lettuce: You'll use lettuce for the Chicken/Mushroom Lettuce cups as well as the Salad Niçoise! Radishes: In the Salad Niçoise! You could add these into your lettuce cups as well- why not? Mushrooms: You'll use mushrooms in the Lettuce Cups, but you could add them into all three lunch/dinner meals and it would work! The fruits and veggies that are in season at the end of March are pretty much the same as what is in season in April! So these ingredients are going to be at their peak for the next few weeks!
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Banoffee Cups, Spinach and Artichoke Pasta, and Chicken/Mushroom Lettuce Cups here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen ready and clean while you let proteins defrost as needed.
  2. Chop everything you need for the main meals (artichoke pasta and mushroom/lettuce cups).
  3. Choose a meal to make first - they're both pretty easy, but shouldn't be done at the same time! The lettuce cups are especially fast.
  4. After you're done making the main meals, get the banoffee oat cups in the oven.
  5. While the oat cups bake, clean the kitchen
  6. Assemble and store your meals, celebrate and relax. You did it!
Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day! Tropical ONOs and the Salad Niçoise for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Start with the nicoise salad! It has a lot of elements and will take a good 30-40 minutes to prepare.
  2. While the nicoise ingredients cool, make the overnight oats.
  3. Clean, celebrate and relax!

title: WWL Minimal Cleanup Plan 03.17.2021
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 

  • For the Banana Bread: Make this your own with add-ins such as coconut flakes, chopped nuts, raisins, cranberries, Nutella, etc.
  • For the Green Smoothies: If you don't like mango, you can use kiwi, pineapple, peaches, or mandarin oranges. Use what you enjoy!
  • For the Pear Salad: If you don't like pears, use apples instead! Quinoa can be replaced with farro and you can also add chicken instead of chickpeas!
  • For the Orzo Skillet: This is a great place to use up leftover veggies! Toss in anything you have lying around.
  • For the Thai Coconut Soup: Shrimp or thinly sliced beef could work in this if you don't want to use chicken. Instead of tofu, use white beans or lentils.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use an all-purpose GF flour in the banana bread. Use GF orzo in the chorizo/soyrizo skillet. Make sure to use GF noodles and liquid aminos instead of soy sauce in the Thai soup.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk for the green smoothies. Use non-dairy milk for the banana bread. Use non-dairy feta such as Violife for the salad, or leave it out. Also, use non-dairy shredded cheese for the orzo skillet.

Tips for a Quick Clean Up!

  • Start with a clean kitchen
  • Wash dishes while your food is cooking
  • Clean up trash and scraps as you go- don't leave it all until the end!
  • It helps some people to use a "garbage bowl" on the counter for food scraps and packaging
  • If you are cooking with meat, put down a flexible cutting mat on your cutting board (if you have one) so you can use your normal cutting board after! You can also use this flexible cutting board to transfer veggies to your pan so you don't make a mess.
  • If you have a dishwasher, load it as you go

Check out our Youtube video about post-meal prep cleanup here!

title: WWL Low Waste Plan 3.10.21
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Blueberry Muffins: You can use fresh or frozen blueberries here! Feel free to add in some chopped nuts as well.
  • For the Overnight Oats: Use any kind of nut butter you prefer! Also, you can totally use frozen berries here too- they will thaw overnight!
  • For the Sweet Potato Skillet: Feel free to add more veggies here - Brussels, zucchini, chopped asparagus, green beans, and chopped eggplant would be great!
  • For the Kale Salads: Feel free to add protein to this salad! Simple grilled chicken or chickpeas would be my first choice.
  • For the Orange Ginger Chicken/Tofu: If you won't finish orange juice, you can also squeeze a few oranges (probably 3) to get the amount of juice you need!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use an all-purpose GF flour for the blueberry muffins. Make sure to grab GF oats for the muffins and the overnight oats! Grab gluten-free noodles and liquid aminos for the Orange Chicken/Tofu.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the overnight oats. Use your favorite dairy-free cheese for the sweet potato skillet! Use your favorite non-dairy cheese crumbles for the Kale Salad!
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com

How to Overlap Ingredients

  • Blueberries: Use them in both the blueberry muffins and the overnight oats!
  • Old fashioned oats: Just like blueberries, old-fashioned oats appear in both the muffins and the overnight oats!
  • Red Onion: Use half in the sweet potato skillet and half in the Kale Salads!
  • Kale: Use one cup in the sweet potato skillet and the rest for the kale salads!
  • Corn: Use in the Sweet Potato Skillet and the Orange Ginger Chicken/Tofu.
  • Cilantro: There is cilantro in the Kale Salads, but it would be great in the Sweet Potato Skillet as well!
  • Garlic: Use garlic in the Orange Ginger Chicken/Tofu and the Sweet Potato Skillet.
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Blueberry Muffins, Sweet Potato Skillet, and Kale Salads on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen ready and clean, defrost proteins as needed!
  2. Make the batter for the muffins and get them in the oven.
  3. While the muffins cook (20 mins) chop everything you need for the Skillet meal and Salad
  4. Make the skillet meal first (it's super easy!)
  5. Then put the salad together
  6. Clean while your meals cool, then pack the food up and store it!
  7. Celebrate and relax. You did it!
Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day! PB&J Overnight Oats and Orange Ginger Chicken/Tofu for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get the orange ginger chicken/tofu going first
  2. While the meal cools down, make the overnight oats
  3. Store the food, clean up and relax! All done.

title: WWL Plan 03.03.21
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Cornbread Waffles: You can easily add chopped bacon, ham, or sausage into these to make them extra filling!
  • For the Starbucks Wraps: If you're not into sun-dried tomatoes, go for roasted red peppers instead! Swap out feta for gorgonzola, blue cheese, or goat cheese!
  • For the Black Bean Soup: If you can't stand black beans, pinto or white beans would work here as well. Feel free to add in any extra veggies you have lying around to this!
  • For the Tikka Masala: Swap out rice for any carb you like, or eat this with pita bread or naan (or both!). You can also make this with beef, lamb, baked tofu, and tempeh.
  • For the Ratatouille: Add mushrooms, artichoke, spinach, or kale. Also, use any you prefer! If you want to try making your own marinara sauce, there is a recipe linked in the blog portion of the recipe!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free cornbread mix for the waffles! Grab gluten-free wraps for your Starbucks copycat wraps! Make sure to use gluten-free pasta for the ratatouille.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk in the waffles, as well as vegan butter. Use your favorite non-dairy cheese for the Starbucks copycat wraps (Violife is a good "feta"). Use non-dairy cheese or nutritional yeast for the ratatouille!
tips:
Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you’re making the Cornbread Waffles, Black Bean Soup, and Tikka Masala on Sunday, here’s how to get it done fast:
     
  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready! Defrost proteins as needed while you set up.
    2.  
  2. Chop everything you need for all three meals. Use big plates to separate ingredients by meal.
    3.  
  3. Make the Tikka Masala first! And don’t forget to cook the rice.
    4.  
  4. Once that’s done, get your soup going. It only takes 20 minutes to cook!
    5.  
  5. While the soup simmers, make the waffle batter and start making waffles.
    6.  
  6. Assemble all your meals and let them cool while you clean up.
    7.  
  7. Store your meals in the fridge, celebrate and relax! You did it!
Don’t forget to order some takeout after your big prep day! Starbucks Spinach Wraps and Ratatouille for a mid-week prep, here’s how to get it done fast:
     
  1. First, cook the filling for your Spinach Feta wraps! It has to cool completely before you wrap.
    2.  
  2. While that cools, make the Ratatouille pasta (just a sheet pan of veggies and a pot of boiling water for pasta!)
    3.  
  3. Assemble the Spinach Feta wraps and grill them.
    4.  
  4. Divide up the Ratatouille pasta between containers and store everything in the fridge!
    5.  
  5. Clean, celebrate and relax!

title: WWL Minimal Cooking 2.24.21
notes:

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Overnight Oats: As always, these are super customizable! Add more fruit such as strawberries, blackberries, raspberries, or bananas.
  • For the Mango Smoothie: If you don't like/ can't find mango, peaches, or even pineapple would work as well! You can also omit the protein powder if you don't have any.
  • For the Egg Roll in a Bowl: We are using a bad of coleslaw mix, but you can absolutely swap that out for fresh purple cabbage, carrots, zucchini, and even bell pepper. Add whatever you have lying around!
  • For the Burrito Bowl Pasta: You can use any kind of ground meat in this that you like (beef, chicken, turkey, pork, or plan-based "meat crumbles).
  • For the Greek Salad Wraps: If you don't have wraps/tortillas, you can use pita bread! You can also omit the wraps and add a grain such as short pasta or quinoa, or simply eat it as a salad!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to grab GF oats for your lemon blueberry overnight oats and the mango smoothie! Swap out the soy sauce for liquid aminos in the egg roll in a bowl recipe! Make sure you grab a short gluten-free pasta for the burrito bowl pasta! Use gluten-free tortillas for the Greek Salad Wraps.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the overnight oats and the mango smoothie. Use your favorite dairy-free cheese in the burrito bowl pasta! Leave out the feta or add-in your favorite non-dairy cheese substitute in the Greek Salad Wraps!
tips:
Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Lemon Blueberry Overnight Oats, Egg Roll in a Bowl and Greek Salad Wraps on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
     
  1. Get your kitchen set up and clean! Defrost proteins as necessary.
    2.  
  2. Chop everything you need for the Greek salad wraps and Egg roll in a bowl.
    3.  
  3. If using chicken for your wraps, get that started first. If not, skip to the next step.
    4.  
  4. When the chicken is done, make the Egg roll in a bowl. Don't forget to cook the rice too! Divide it into containers and set aside.
    5.  
  5. Next, toss together the salad for the wraps. Make the tzatziki or hummus too. Pack everything up and set aside.
    6.  
  6. last, make your overnight oats!
    7.  
  7. Put everything in the fridge and clean up.
    8.  
  8. Celebrate and relax. You're done!
Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day! Mango Smoothies and Burrito Bowl Pasta for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
     
  1. Get the pasta dish going first!
    2.  
  2. While it cooks, prep your smoothies.
    3.  
  3. Assemble the pasta in meal prep containers and store.
    4.  
  4. Clean, celebrate and relax!

title: WWL Plan 02.17.21
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Breakfast Empanadas: These are extremely customizable! Add in all your favorite veggies and your choice of protein. Cooked chorizo or bacon would be delicious.
  • For the Cherry Pancakes: Fresh or frozen cherries would both work here! If using frozen, let them thaw on the counter for a few hours before cooking.
  • For the Kung Poa Noodles: So many different veggies would work in this- broccoli/cauliflower, Chinese eggplant, green beans, bok choy, zucchini, etc! Use up whatever is left in your fridge.
  • For the Lasagna Soup: Another great recipe to use up any veggies lying around! Adding some ricotta cheese or fresh basil on top would bring this soup to the next level!
  • For the Enchiladas: You can easily make your own enchilada sauce instead of using store-bought (notes in recipe!) These are filling with no meat, but ground beef, turkey, or chicken would be great!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use GF all-purpose flour for the breakfast empanadas and the cherry pancakes. Grab gluten-free noodles for the Kung Poa Noodles and the Lasagna Soup. You will need gluten-free tortillas for the enchiladas. You will also need liquid aminos instead of soy sauce in the Kung Poa Noodles!
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy cheese in the breakfast empanadas, lasagna soup, and the enchiladas. You will also need non-dairy milk for the cherry pancakes and the lasagna soup!
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Breakfast Empanadas, Kung Pao Noodles, and Lasagna Soup on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen ready and clean! Defrost proteins as needed while you set up.
  2. Chop everything you need for the empanadas, stir fry and soup. It's going to be a lot of chopping, so throw on a podcast.
  3. If using tofu, press it and marinate it now. Make the sauce for the stir fry just to have it ready to go. Set aside.
  4. Get the soup going. It's very simple (just three steps!)
  5. While the soup cooks, make the stir fry. The soup can sit on the stove for awhile and doesn't need a ton of attention.
  6. Divide the soup and stir fry into containers and let them cool.
  7. If you're up for it, make the dough for empanadas. Note that the dough can last in the fridge for 2 days! So if you need to stop here, this is a good spot.
  8. Make the filling for the empanadas and get them in the oven.
  9. Clean while the empanadas bake.
  10. Celebrate and relax!
Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day! Cherry Pancakes and Veggie Enchiladas for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get the enchiladas ready to go first, and get them in the oven.
  2. While they bake, start cooking the pancakes!
  3. Assemble your meals and enjoy the rest of your week.

notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Raspberry Doughnuts: If you do not have a doughnut pan, you can easily make these into muffins! Swap raspberries for strawberries if they are not your favorite.
  • For the Savory Oats: You can add more veggies here if you want! Mushrooms and caramelized onions would be delicious.
  • For the BBQ Mash Bowls: You can use regular potatoes, or even cauliflower if you do not like sweet potato! Feel free to swap the green beans for your favorite green veggie.

  • For the Carne/Mushroom Asada Tacos: Replace beef with chicken breast, chicken thigh, shrimp, pork tenderloin or fish. Swap mushrooms out for tempeh or tofu if necessary.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use GF flour for the doughnuts and make sure your oats are GF in the savory miso oats. Use GF orzo in the Cajun orzo skillet! Make sure to grab gluten-free tortillas for the tacos!
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk in the doughnuts! Use your favorite non-dairy milk in the mashed sweet potatoes. Either use your favorite non-dairy cheese or simply omit it for the tacos!
tips:
Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Raspberry Swirl Doughnuts, BBQ Mash Bowls, and Cajun-inspired Orzo Skillet on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
     
  1. Get your kitchen clean, set up and ready to go! Defrost proteins as needed while you do this.

  2. Chop everything you need for the skillet and mash bowls.
    3.  
  3. Get your potatoes for the mash bowl going first. Then cook the green beans and protein.
    4.  
  4. Get the skillet going! Once you've added your orzo and are ready to let it simmer, mash the potatoes and finish the mash bowls
    5.

  6. Make the doughnut recipe from start to finish.

Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day! Savory Miso Oats and Carne/Mushroom Asada Tacos for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:

title: WWL Plan 2.3.21
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what’s available. 
     
  • For the Oatmeal Bake: If you don’t like the apple and carrot combination, you can use zucchini, pear, banana, butternut squash, or sweet potato.
    •  
  • For the Biscuits and Gravy: Spice these up with some add-ins such as cheese, jalapeno, chives, bacon bits, or scallions!
    •  
  • For the Broccoli Rice Casserole: Feel free to add more veggies into this! It is the perfect meal to use up any leftovers lying around.
    •  
  • For the Sweet Potato Chili: If you are not a fan of sweet potatoes, you can use Yukon Gold. Add in any additional veggies you enjoy!
    •  
  • For the Chow Mein: Easily change the protein by cooking shrimp, pork, beef, tofu, tempeh, seitan, or edamame.
    •  
  • Gluten-free swaps: Make sure to use GF oats in the oatmeal bake, and gluten-free flour in the biscuits! You will also need gluten-free noodles for the chow mein. Use liquid aminos instead of soy sauce in the chow mein.
    •  
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite dairy-free milk for the oatmeal bake, the biscuits and gravy and the broccoli cheddar casserole! You will also need non-dairy cheese in the broccoli cheddar casserole!
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Morning Glory Oatmeal Bake, Broccoli Rice Casserole, and Sweet Potato Chili on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Two casseroles in one day let's do this! Get your kitchen set up and clean. Defrost any proteins you're using.
  2. Get the morning glory bake in the oven first.
  3. While it bakes, chop everything you need for the broccoli rice casserole and sweet potato chili.
  4. Start cooking the sweet potato chili. It's pretty hands-off!
  5. Prepare the broccoli rice casserole elements (chicken if using, rice, sauce, veggies) and get it in the oven.
  6. Clean up while the chili cooks and casserole bakes.
  7. Celebrate and RELAX!
Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day! Biscuits and Gravy and Chow Mein for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Prep the dough for the biscuits and put them in the freezer while your oven preheats.
  2. Prepare the ingredients for the chow mein.
  3. Bake the biscuits and cook the chow mein.
  4. Make the gravy (if using) and store on the side until you eat the biscuits.
  5. Pack everything up and enjoy the rest of your week!

title: WWL Plan 01.27.21
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Chocolate Muffins: You can easily swap out zucchini for shredded carrot or mashed banana! Use a flax egg if you are vegan!
  • For the Okonomiyaki: You can go crazy with the toppings here! Use bacon, chopped deli meat, your favorite seafood, or a fried egg!
  • For the Pozole Rojo: if you don't like pork, you can use chicken (preferably bone-in), beef, or even shrimp. To swap out the jackfruit, you can use tofu, tempeh, chickpeas, or beans!
  • For the Crunchy Thai Salads: If you can't use peanut butter, swap it out for a creamy nut butter. If you can't use nut butter, you can change the flavor profile to BBQ!
  • For the White Bean Pasta: Artichoke, broccoli, cauliflower, or asparagus would all be great here. Swap white beans for chickpeas, pinto beans, chicken, ground turkey/beef, or chicken sausage.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free flour for the muffins, okonomiyaki, and white bean pasta. Use your favorite GF pasta in the white bean pasta meal. Use liquid aminos for the okonomiyaki and Thai salads to replace soy sauce. Add gluten-free tortilla chips for the pozole rojo.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk in the muffins and in the white bean pasta.
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Double Chocolate Zucchini Muffins, Pozole Rojo, and Crunchy Thai Salads on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen set up and ready to go! Defrost proteins as needed.
  2. Chop everything you need for the Pozole and Crunchy Thai Salads (including the toppings for the Pozole)
  3. Start the Crunchy Thai Salad recipe first, since the elements need to cool down completely before you assemble them (protein and quinoa)
  4. While the Thai Salads cool off, make the Pozole Rojo! There's a lot of passive time in this recipe once it's simmering.
  5. While your soup is simmering, make the Double Chocolate Zucchini Muffins
  6. While the muffins bake and your soup is finishing off, clean the kitchen
  7. Don't forge to store your meals in the fridge! Order takeout and CELEBRATE! You did it!
Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day. Okonomiyaki and Balsamic Mushroom White Bean Pasta for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. The easiest way to tackle this mid-week prep would be doing one recipe at a time! You choose which to do first. Both are pretty quick and painless!

title: WWL Plan 01.20.21
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Breakfast Burritos: If you don't like chorizo/soyrizo, you can use sausage, bacon, "meat" crumbles, or any bean you enjoy! Use up all your extra veggies here.
  • For the Banana Bars: Add your favorite dried fruit, crushed nuts, and seeds to these! Any type of nut butter would work here.
  • For the Sesame Chicken/ Tofu: You can use shrimp, beef, tempeh, chickpeas, or chopped up cauliflower to replace the protein here! Swap out the noodles for rice or quinoa.
  • For the Lasagna: This recipe is plenty filling on its own, but you can easily add ground beef, ground turkey, or veggie "meat" crumbles to this!
  • For the Feta Burgers: If you aren't into feta, try gorgonzola, goat cheese or blue cheese. Swap out ground turkey for chicken or beef, and white beans for chickpeas!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free tortillas for the breakfast burritos. Use GF old fashioned oats for the banana breakfast bars. Use gluten-free noodles for the Sesame Chicken and Lasagna. Use liquid aminos for the sesame chicken/tofu as well!
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use dairy-free shredded cheese in the breakfast burritos. Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the banana breakfast bars. Instructions for tofu ricotta are in the lasagna recipe! Make sure to use non-dairy shredded cheese as well. Instead of feta, use pitted and chopped kalamata olives.
tips:
Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Chorizo/Soyrizo Breakfast Burritos, Sesame Chicken/Tofu and Lasagna on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen prepped and ready! Defrost proteins if you need any for this prep.
  2. Chop everything you need for all three recipes. This will take a while! I recommend putting on a podcast.
  3. Start with the breakfast burritos. The filling needs to cool completely before you wrap them up. Preheat your oven too.
  4. While the filling cools, start the lasagna and get it in the oven.
  5. While the lasagna bakes, wrap your burritos and store them.
  6. Then get the Sesame Tofu/Chicken started on the stove.
  7. Assemble meals in containers and let them cool while you clean up!
  8. Pack everything away in the fridge/freezer and CELEBRATE! We recommend getting takeout after your prep sesh.
Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day. Banana Breakfast Bars and Feta Burgers for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. First, get the banana breakfast bars ready and in the oven.
  2. Then make the burger recipe!
  3. Clean up and enjoy for the rest of the week.
