title: WWL Plan 1.13.21
notes:
Swap Notes

  • For the Waffles: Use any type of jam or jelly you prefer in these! We would recommend strawberry, raspberry, blackberry, grape, apricot or peach!
  • For the Parfaits: Add any fruit you enjoy to these! If you don't feel like making the homemade granola, you can use store-bought!
  • For the Teriyaki Meatballs: You can easily swap the veggies in this meal! Bell pepper, mixed frozen veggies, green beans, asparagus, Brussels sprouts, sauteed greens, mushrooms, bok choy, eggplant, cauliflower, cabbage or snap peas would work.
  • For the Honey Dijon Green Bowls: You can absolutely use store-bought honey dijon dressing if you do not want to make it! You can also easily swap out orzo for quinoa or rice.
  • For the Squash Soup: Swap out the butternut squash for pumpkin, acorn squash, sweet potato, or cauliflower.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free flour for the waffles. Use GF oats for the Parfaits! Make sure to use FG bread crumbs in the teriyaki meatballs. Use GF orzo in the honey dijon green bowls, or swap it out for quinoa.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the waffles and in the squash soup. Make sure to grab non-dairy yogurt for the parfaits!
tips:
Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Granola Parfaits, Teriyaki Meatballs, and Honey Dijon Green Bowls on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen ready for a good prep! Make sure to defrost proteins as needed.
  2. Chop everything you need for both the Teriyaki Meatball meals and Honey Dijon Bowls. Preheat your oven.
  3. Roast the sweet potatoes for the Honey Dijon bowls and if using tofu, now is a good time to press it.
  4. Make the Teriyaki Meatball meal from start to finish.
  5. Reset the kitchen a bit (I like to put food away and dump dishes in the sink)
  6. Finish the Honey Dijon bowls (the dressing, orzo and cooking the protein)
  7. Finally, make the granola for the parfaits.
  8. As the granola bakes, clean the kitchen
  9. Assemble parfaits and you're done!
Don't forget to order some takeout after your big prep day. Nut Butter & Jelly Waffles and Sheet Pan Squash Soup for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Prep the veggie for your soup and preheat the oven!
  2. While the veggies bake, make the waffles
  3. When the veggies are done, blend them up and divide the soup between your containers.
  4. That's it!

title: WWL Plan 1-6-21
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Savory Cheddar Muffins: You can throw in spices like cayenne or chili powder for some heat or try this recipe with different cheese!
  • For the Horchata Overnight Oats: Omit the almonds if you are allergic/ don't like them. Berries or bananas would be a great topping here.
  • For the Thai Curry Tacos: Swap red curry paste for green or yellow. You can use chicken breasts, shrimp or beef instead of chicken thighs, and tofu or tempeh instead of cauliflower!
  • For the Red Pepper Pasta: Add more veggies to this meal with mushrooms, peas, eggplant, broccoli, cauliflower, zucchini, and summer squash.
  • For the Falafel Salads: You can add pretty much any veggie to these salads! Different types of homemade dressings/sauces are linked in the recipe notes.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use all-purpose gluten-free flour for the Cheddar Muffins. Use gluten-free oats in the Horchata ONOs. Use GF tortillas for the curry tacos. Use gluten-free pasta for the Red Pepper Pasta. Also, use GF flour for the falafel.
  • Dairy-free swaps: For the Cheddar Muffins use non-dairy cheddar cheese (I like the brand Daiya). Use dairy-free yogurt and your favorite non-dairy milk for the horchata ONOs. Use non-dairy milk and nutritional yeast in the Red Pepper Pasta! Leave out the feta cheese in the falafel chopped salads or, add in your favorite non-dairy cheese.
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Savory Cheddar Muffins, Thai Curry Tacos, and Red Pepper Pasta on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get ready for an awesome prep! I highly recommend starting with a clean kitchen. Defrost proteins as needed.
  2. Get the red bell peppers and garlic in the oven first, since they need 30 mins to roast and then 10-15 mins to cool.
  3. Prepare the protein/cauliflower for your taco meal.
  4. Finish the bell pepper pasta sauce and dish. Set aside.
  5. Make the cheddar muffin batter and get them in the oven.
  6. While the muffins cook, finish the taco meal by cooking our protein/cauliflower and prepping the slaw
  7. Celebrate, clean and relax! You earned it!
Horchata Overnight Oats and Crispy Falafel Salads for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Prepare the falafels. While they bake/cook, prepare the other salad elements.
  2. While the falafels cool, make the overnight oats!

meals.title: Crispy Falafel And Chopped Salad Bowls
Crispy Falafel And Chopped Salad Bowls
Crispy Falafel And Chopped Salad Bowls

title: WWL Plan 12.30.20
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available.
  • For the Caramel Granola: Use any add-ins that you enjoy! Dried fruit, chocolate chips, nuts, and seeds (After cooking).
  • For the Zucchini Bread: If you are not into zucchini, you can easily swap it out for shredded carrots! Enjoy your favorite add-ins here as well!
  • For the Sushi Bowls: Add in more veggies such as shiitake mushrooms, carrots, asparagus, bell pepper, and scallions! Notes on switching up the proteins are in the recipe description!
  • For the Verde Enchiladas: Swap shredded chicken for ground turkey, ground beef, or "meat" crumbles. You can use any beans you have on hand instead of black beans!
  • For the Lentil Tomato Soup: You can easily swap lentils for quinoa or rice. Use fire roasted tomatoes if you like heat and want a different flavor!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use an all-purpose gluten free flour for the zucchini bread. Use gluten-free tortillas for the enchiladas. Grab some gluten free bread for your lentil tomato soup!
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use coconut milk instead of heavy cream in the caramel granola. Use your favorite non-dairy cheese in the enchiladas.
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Caramel Granola, Sushi Bowls, and Verde Enchiladas on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen set up and ready to go! Meanwhile, defrost proteins you might need.
  2. If making chicken enchiladas, get the chicken in the oven first. It needs time to bake and rest a bit before shredding.
  3. Preheat your oven. Chop everything you need for the enchiladas and sushi bowls. Pro tip: place chopped and prepped ingredients on two separate big plates/trays so you don't get ingredients mixed up!
  4. Prep the sushi bowls from start to finish (you only need to cook the protein and the rice).
  5. Cook the filling for the enchiladas. Assemble them and get them in the oven.
  6. While the enchiladas bake, clean up a bit and make your caramel (make sure you're paying full attention to the caramel!)
  7. Prepare the granola to go in the oven. When the enchiladas are done, reduce the oven heat.
  8. Clean while your granola bakes (make sure to check it every 10 mins)
  9. Get the sushi bowls and enchiladas in the fridge, finish cleaning and CELEBRATE!
  10. Let the granola cool for a few hours. I've left mine out overnight accidentally and it was fine the next day!
Zucchini Bread and Lentil Tomato Soup for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Make the zucchini bread batter and get it in the oven first.
  2. While the bread bakes, make the soup!
  3. Clean up and enjoy.

title: WWL Plan 12.16.20
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 
  • For the Snickerdoodle Pancakes: You'll need vegan butter/ coconut oil and flax eggs if you want to make these vegan! Notes on how to make the cream cheese drizzle vegan are in the recipe!
  • For the Berry Smoothies: Other fruits that would work in these are banana, peach, mango, pineapple, raspberries, papaya, plums, and guava! Feel free to add-in spinach, avocado, nut butter, and seeds as well!
  • For the Chicken/Chickpea Gyros: You can use shredded chicken, pork, beef slices, shrimp, seitan, tempeh, mushrooms, or falafel! Add in all of your favorite crunchy veggies.
  • For the Indonesian Fried Rice: Add-in any of your favorite veggies here. If you don't like eggs, you can leave them out completely. Sub sambal for sriracha or chili garlic sauce.
  • For the Pizza Orzo: Use any small pasta if you can't find orzo. Any of your favorite pizza topping vegetables will work in this!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use gluten-free flour for the pancakes. Use gluten-free pitas for the gyros. You can order gluten-free orzo on Amazon here
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use dairy-free milk in the snickerdoodle pancakes (Notes on making the cream cheese drizzle dairy free are in the recipe!) Use non-dairy milk and yogurt in the smoothies. Use our tahini sauce instead of tzatziki in the chicken/chickpeas. Use your favorite non-dairy cheese in the pizza orzo skillet, we like Daiya!
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Snickerdoodle Pancakes, Chicken/Chickpea Gyros, and Nasi- Goreng Fried Rice on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready to go! Meanwhile, defrost proteins you may need for this prep.
  2. First, chop everything you need for the Gyro and Fried Rice meals. Throw on a podcast while you chop!
  3. Marinate chicken if using for the Gyros. It needs at least 20 minutes!
  4. Make the rice for the fried rice now so it can cool down a bit before you cook.
  5. Finish the Gyro meal first (sweet potatoes, sauce, fixings, cooking the protein)
  6. Then finish the fried rice (protein, sauce, cooking everything with the rice)
  7. Reset your kitchen.
  8. While your meals cool, make the pancakes if you're still up for it!
  9. Clean, celebrate and relax.
 Very Berry Smoothies and Pizza Orzo Skillet for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. This is an easy prep! Make the Pizza Orzo Skillet.
  2. While it cooks, prep some smoothie bags.
  3. Clean, relax and celebrate!
Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG! If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: WWL Meal Plan- December 9, 2020
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 
  • For the Lemon Blueberry Bread: You can customize this recipe with chopped nuts, seeds, or an optional glaze (instructions are in the notes!).
  • For the Breakfast Fritters: You can easily swap regular potatoes for sweet potatoes here! Eat these with toppings such as applesauce, sour cream, yogurt, eggs, etc!
  • For the Gnocchi Soup: Swap out the gnocchi for a different short pasta, or even tortellini. Add in any extra veggies that you enjoy!
  • For the Pad Thai: Swap the chicken/tofu for shrimp, tempeh, or seitan. Add crushed peanuts or cashews, bean sprouts, cilantro, green onion and lime wedges as toppings.
  • For the Grain Bowls: These are extremely customizable! Add any roast veggies that you enjoy. If you don't like barley or can't find it, use rice, quinoa, or farro.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use an all-purpose GF flour for the Lemon Blueberry Bread. Use GF gnocchi in the soup. Use liquid aminos or tamari to replace soy sauce in the Pad Thai. Use quinoa or rice instead of barley in the Winter Grain Bowls.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk and yogurt for the Lemon Blueberry Bread. Use non-dairy milk instead of half n half in the soup. Omit the feta cheese or use non-dairy cheese crumbles in the winter grain bowls.
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Lemon Blueberry Bread, Italian Gnocchi Soup, and Pad Thai on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. First, get your kitchen ready and clean while your proteins defrost.
  2. Chop everything you need for the soup and pad Thai recipes. Pro tip: listen to a podcast while doing it.
  3. Make the soup first from start to finish. It's pretty quick and you can leave it in the pot while doing other things.
  4. Then, make the pad Thai from start to finish. This is not one you want to multitask.
  5. Finally, make the bread recipe.
  6. While it's baking, assemble your two main meal recipes in containers and clean up the kitchen a bit! (I put everything away, wipe down counters and leave dishes for a little later)
  7. Celebrate and relax!
 Carrot & Potato Fritters and Winter Veggie Grain Bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. First, chop and prep everything you need for these two recipes.
  2. Get the veggies for the grain bowls in the oven first. Start cooking the barley.
  3. While the veggies roast, cook your fritters on the stove.
  4. Assemble the grain bowls and fritters in meal prep containers.
  5. Make the sauce for the grain bowls.
  6. Celebrate, clean and relax!
Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG! If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: WWL Meal Plan- December 2, 2020
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 
  • For the Muffins: Fresh, frozen, or dried cranberries would all work in these, as well as freshly squeezed or bottled orange juice. To make these vegan, use a flax egg (notes in recipe).
  • For the Breakfast Sandwiches: Use any greens and additional veggies you like (except tomatoes)! Add any cheese you like, but note that shredded cheese can get messy!
  • For the Chickpea Veggie Scramble: This recipe would still work with white beans if you don’t like chickpeas. It is also very customizable, add any veggies you like!
  • For the Pelau: You swap chicken thighs for chicken breast, chicken sausage, shrimp, beef strips, pinto beans, or even chickpeas. If you do not like heat, leave out the serrano peppers!
  • For the Pasta: If you can't find swiss chard, use kale or spinach instead. Whatever makes the most sense for you!
  • For the Lentil Quesadillas: If you don't like lentils use black beans or chickpeas! Mashed white beans will work too. You can also add more veggies such as cauliflower, zucchini, corn, mushrooms, and greens.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use a GF all-purpose flour for the muffins. Make sure to use GF English muffins if you're making the breakfast sandwiches. You will need GF pasta as well as GF tortillas for the quesadillas!
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy cheese in the breakfast sandwiches as well as in the quesadillas. Either use non-dairy cheese crumbles in on top of the pasta or simply leave it out!
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Cranberry Orange Muffins, Chicken/Veg Pelau, and Pasta with Swiss Chard on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen ready to go! Defrost any proteins as needed.
  2. Chop everything you need for the Pelau and Pasta meals.
  3. Start off with the Pelau. It's a one-pot wonder, and once the rice is in, you can move onto something else.
  4. While the rice cooks, get the pasta going.
  5. When both meals are done cooking, you can leave them on the stove while you make your muffin batter.
  6. While the muffins bake, clean up the kitchen and pack away your meals.
  7. That's it! Celebrate and relax. Remember that you can always clean up later! I never do it right after prepping.
Breakfast Sandwiches or Scrambles and Lentil Quesadillas for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Make the lentils for the quesadillas.
  2. Then get your breakfast option going, as it will need time to cool!
  3. While your breakfast option cooks/cools, finish the quesadilla recipe.
  4. Clean while the meals cool, then you're done!
Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG! If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: WWL Meal Plan- November 25, 2020
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 
  • For the Pancakes: Feel free to add nuts, chia seeds, chocolate chips, white chocolate chips, caramel chips! Notes on DIY pumpkin spice mix and flax eggs are in the recipe!
  • For the Quinoa Power Bowls: If you don't love quinoa, you can use any grain of your choice. Use up any veggies you have in these! Add more protein such as sausage or beans!
  • For the Tortilla Soup: This is freezer-friendly. Any type of beans work! This can be a slow cooker recipe if you have one. If vegan or DF, use regular corn instead of creamed corn.
  • For the Pot Pies: These are perfect for all the Thanksgiving leftovers you may find yourself with! They're freezer-friendly. Really any veggies and meat can go into these. Feel free to make your own pie crusts if you don't want to use store-bought! Note that you'll need to use vegan/vegetarian pie crust, as some refrigerated crusts may have butter or lard. You can also turn these into shepherd's pies with leftover mashed potatoes instead of crust!
  • For the Sheet Pan Meals: You can use chicken, beef, shrimp, or your favorite fish here if you don't like salmon! Instead of farro, use your favorite grain! The veggies are extremely customizable as well.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use all-purpose gluten-free flour for the pancakes. Use a gluten-free grain instead of farro in the sheet pan meals.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk for the pumpkin pancakes and in the pot pies. Use non-dairy shredded cheese for the tortilla soup. Use regular corn instead of creamed corn in the soup. Skip the feta or use your favorite non-dairy cheese for the sheet pan meals. Use vegan pie crust for the pot pies.
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Pumpkin Pancakes, Tortilla Soup, and Mini Pot Pies on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get ready for a super easy prep by cleaning your kitchen and defrosting proteins as needed.
  2. Get your soup going first - it's one pot!
  3. Preheat your oven.
  4. Then, get your pot pie filling ready on the stove.
  5. While the pot pies bake, make the pancake batter.
  6. While the meals cool, cook your pancakes.
  7. Clean, celebrate and relax! Pro tip: get takeout after a prep session.
Quinoa Power Bowls and Mediterranean Sheet Pan Meals for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get the Mediterranea Sheet Pan meals in the oven.
  2. Then prep/cook the quinoa bowls.
  3. Let everything cool while you clean.
  4. Enjoy!
Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG! If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: WWL Plan 11.18.20
notes:
Don't forget to leave a rating on each recipe to let us know how you liked them! We love seeing your photos in the Workweek Prepper's FB group too.

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 
  • For the Apple Oatmeal Bake: Any apples will work in this! Use your favorite dried fruit and nuts for add-ins (avoid sunflower seeds, they don't bake well!) Use a flax egg if needed.
  • For the Shakshuka: Add a starch to this to make it satisfying! You can swap bread for potatoes, sweet potatoes or a starchy veggie like cauliflower.
  • For the White Bean Chili: Feel free to add/change up the veggies in this! Add-in poblano peppers, green beans, peas, shredded brussels sprouts, spinach, kale, swiss chard and red onion.
  • For the Curry: Use ground turkey, pork, beef, chickpeas, or white beans in the meatballs instead of chicken/ cauliflower. Alternatives to coconut milk and miso paste are listed in the recipe!
  • For the Quesadillas: Really any veggies will work here, use up any that you have laying around or leftover! If you don't want to add potatoes or sweet potatoes, add a side of quinoa/rice, or simply leave them out!
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use GF oats in the apple oatmeal bake. Put the shakshuka over gluten-free bread. Use GF tortillas for the quesadillas.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk for the apple oatmeal bake. Use dairy-free cheese in the quesadillas
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Apple Oat Bake, White Bean Chili, and Miso Ginger Meatballs on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen clean and ready to go! While you clean, defrost proteins as needed.
  2. Chop everything you need for the chili and meatball meals.
  3. Make the meatball meal first. It has the most elements and requires the most energy.
  4. When the meatball meal is done, get the chili going.
  5. While the chili simmers, get your oat bake going.
  6. While the oat bake cooks in the oven, start cleaning up!
  7. Finish cleaning, pack up your oat bake and relax!
  8. Don't forget to order takeout/pickup food to go- you've earned it!
Shakshuka and Farmer's Market Quesadillas for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Chop everything you need for both meals.
  2. Get the quesadillas in the oven first.
  3. While the quesadillas bake, make the shakshuka.
  4. Clean up, relax and enjoy!
Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG! If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: WWL Plan 11.11.20
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 
  • For the Quinoa Cups: If you don't like banana, you can use apple sauce in these!Swap the berries for banana or apple. Use a flax egg if you are making these vegan (instructions in recipe)
  • For the Overnight Oats: Feel free to add toppings such as pepitas, almonds, chia seeds, etc to these! You can also top them with fresh fruit.
  • For the Pineapple Wraps: You can swap the shredded chicken for turkey! You can also add in more cooked veggies such as broccoli/cauliflower, red onion, bell peppers, mushrooms, etc.
  • For the Bibimbap Bowls: Noodles, quinoa, farro, or other short grains would work if you don't want to use rice. If you don enjoy pickled veggies, leave them raw! Any type of ground meat would work here. We recommend grabbing gochujang sauce to add to your bowls if you are all about Korean flavors!
  • For the Enchilada Bake: Add ground beef, turkey, sausage, or chicken to the veggie mix. You can also add-in more veggies such as zucchini, broccoli, cauliflower, cabbage, onions, peas or chopped up great beans.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use GF flour in the quinoa cups! Make sure your oats are GF for the overnight oats. Use gluten free pasta in the enchilada bake!
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy milk and vegan butter in the quinoa cups. Also use non-dairy milk in the overnight oats. Use your favorite non-dairy cheese in the enchilada bake!
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Berry Baked Quinoa Cups, Sweet & Spicy Pineapple Wraps, and Enchilada Pasta Bake on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Get your kitchen set up and ready to go! I always recommend starting with a clean kitchen. Defrost proteins as needed while you get set up.
  2. Chop everything you need for the wraps and get ingredients ready for the pasta bake.
  3. Cook the ingredients for the wraps first, since they need to cool.
  4. Make quinoa for the cups.
  5. Get the enchilada bake in the oven next.
  6. While the enchilada bake is in the oven, make the quinoa cup batter.
  7. Bake the quinoa cups while you assemble the wraps.
  8. Clean, celebrate and RELAX! Pro tip: we always order takeout after a day of meal prepping.
Pumpkin Spice Overnight Oats and Bibimbap Bowls for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. First, start making the bibimbap bowls.
  2. While the elements for the bowls cook, make the overnight oats.
  3. That's it!
Don't forget to take pics of your preps so you can show them off on Facebook and IG! If you need any help with anything, please reach out to support@workweeklunch.com

title: WWL Plan 11.4.20
notes:
Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 
  • For the Breakfast Cookies: If you don't like bananas, you can replace them with applesauce or yogurt! Add-in white chocolate chips, caramel chips, raisins or dried cranberries!
  • For the Breakfast Burritos: These are super customizable! Add any veggies you have laying around, and add-in any additional spices that you enjoy!
  • For the Quinoa Kale Salads: Use spinach or arugula if you don't like kale. Instead of chickpeas, use lentils, beans, or grilled chicken. Go crazy with the toppings by adding golden raisins, olives, walnuts, or goat cheese.
  • For the Pad See Ew: Swap out the rice noodles for spaghetti or a different long noodle of your choice! Add in veggies such as spinach, mushrooms, broccoli, snap peas, carrots, eggplant, etc.
  • For the Tomato Soup: Feel free to add a protein in here such as chickpeas or shredded chicken. You can also add-in cheese! Add in sliced ham or bacon to the grilled cheeses if you want some protein.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use GF oats in the breakfast cookies. Use GF tortillas for the breakfast burritos! Make sure to use a GF noodle in the Pad See Ew. Use a GF bread when making the Grilled Cheese Sandwiches.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use non-dairy cheese in the breakfast burritos if needed. Use non-dairy cheese crumbles in the salad, or simply omit them. Use non-dairy milk instead of heavy cream in the tomato soup!
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Banana Oat Breakfast Cookies, Kale Butternut Squash Salads, and Pad See Ew on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. Prepare and clean your kitchen and defrost any proteins as needed.
  2. First, chop the butternut squash for the salads and get it in the oven.
  3. Chop everything else you need for the Pad See Ew and salads.
  4. Make the Pad See Ew from start to finish - it's a quick one!
  5. Then prepare the breakfast cookies and get them in the oven.
  6. While they bake, finish off the salads.
  7. Clean, celebrate and relax!
Breakfast Burritos and Tomato Soup With Grilled Cheese for a mid-week prep, here's how to get it done fast:
  1. First make the filling for the breakfast burritos, because it has to cool.
  2. Then move onto the soup.
  3. While the soup simmers, roll up and finish your breakfast burritos.
  4. Blend the soup, finish with milk/cream and store it in the fridge for freezer.
  5. That's it!

title: WWL Plan 10.28.20
notes:

Swap Notes

This section will help you customize the recipes based on what you have and what's available. 
  • For the Muffins: Switch out carrot and apple for zucchini, pear, banana, butternut squash and sweet potato. Use a flax egg (notes on how to make them in recipe) if you want to make these vegan.
  • For the Overnight Oats: If you make coffee at home regularly, brew 1 cup extra if you plan on making three servings of mocha overnight oats. Swap out fruit completely for crushed almonds, pecans or cashews.
  • For the Thai Coconut Soup: You can roast additional veggies to toss into this soup (instructions in recipe), or add greens like spinach or kale. Use any short pasta you enjoy.
  • For the Baked Ziti: This is a great meal to use up fresh herbs if you have any! If you eat meat, you can add ground beef, turkey, or chicken into this.
  • For the Fiesta Rice: Sausage links are optional here, leave them out or swap for your favorite protein! Substitute black beans for pinto beans or your favorite legumes, lentils also work.
  • Gluten-free swaps: Use GF flour in the muffins. Use GF oats for the overnight oats. You will need gluten-free pasta for the soup and baked ziti meals.
  • Dairy-free swaps: Use your favorite non-dairy milk in the overnight oats. Use dairy-free cheese for the baked ziti.
If you have any other questions about recipe swaps, don't hesitate to reach out directly to me: talia@workweeklunch.com
tips:
Meal Prep Multitasking Tips

Ready for a super fast and easy prep on Sunday (or your big prep day)? If you're making the Morning Glory Muffins, Thai Coconut Soup, and Baked Ziti on Sunday, here's how to get it done fast:
1. Get your kitchen clean and ready to go while defrosting proteins.
2. Chop everything you need for the soup and baked ziti recipe.
3. Get the veggies roasting for the ziti recipe first.
4. Start the soup while the veggies roast. It takes about 20-30 mins to make!
5. Cook the pasta, then assemble the baked ziti. Get it in the oven.

7. Make the morning glory muffin batter and bake.
8. Clean up while the muffins bake.

2. Get the fiesta rice going first!
3. While it's cooking on the stove, clean up and make the overnight oats.
